results.body: Integrated Resort

reviews.text: Awesome place to visit! What a beautiful structure man has ever built. Simply marvellous! This building is stunning and looks even more gorgeous in the evening or night. Laser guided show make this building one of its kind. Evening or night is the best time to visit.

Iconic and  beautiful, luxurious hotel. The infinity pool is amazing and the views from the top are very nice, especially at night. Nice, clean rooms with an amazing view (I was on the 37th floor, facing the city). Breakfast buffet is really excellent and there are some very nice restaurants inside the hotel. Walking distance to the Gardens by the bay and the centre. Highly recommended!

Love the place. Relatively less crowded  compared to other shopping centres. There are only one halal restaurant in this area. The Science Art Museum is nearby. Casinos are just around the corner. Great laser light shows at night.

One of the most iconic hotel and business complex in Singapore. The place is upscale and exuberant with high end brands, a theater on the river front, an observatory deck on top, and some offices as well. The restaurants serve appetizing gourmet food with a wide variety of dishes. You can get a panoramic view of the city and the beautiful skyline across the bay. Also you can spot the F1 circuit around the Singapore flyer from the observatory deck.

Highly recommend a stay at marina bay sands. Stunning swimming infinity pool across the top of the building with great views. Close to all amenities such as casino which is pretty amazing and shopping galore. It was definitely difficult navigating your way through the 3 towers although very impressive indeed. The only letdown was my friend had left his watch behind in his room on check out when he went back it was gone! Management were not very helpful at all.

results.description: The Marina Bay Sands integrated resort comprises convention and exhibition facilities, 2,561­ hotel rooms and suites, a casino spanning four floors, and the Sands Theatre that features Broadway and West End musicals, amongst others. Sitting 57 floors aboveground is the Sands SkyPark with its iconic 150-metre-long infinity pool. Alongside are restaurants, bars, nightclubs and an observation deck from which to take in sweeping, 360-degree views of the city. The resort’s luxury mall, The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands, features an extensive selection of designer boutiques, celebrity chef restaurants and dining options. The integrated resort is also home to the lotus-shaped ArtScience Museum – the first of its kind in the world – and Spectra, a kaleidoscopic outdoor light and water show that takes place nightly over the waters fronting the Event Plaza.
results.name: Marina Bay Sands

results.body:
Located at the tip of our Club's breakwater is Raffles Marina's own lighthouse. Built in 1994 and overlooking the Tuas Second Link - Singapore's second causeway to Malaysia, this 12 metres high icon flashes every 10 seconds with a beam that reaches 15 metres. The lighthouse is maintained by the Club and is the only lighthouse not owned and operated by the Maritime Port Authority of Singapore.

The beacon is also a popular spot for cycling communities, leisure photography groups and bloggers. Some of these photographs have been featured on sites such as Pinterest, Flickr and on Instagram via this hashtag, #rafflesmarinalighthouse.

The lighthouse, together with the marina, has been featured on wedding and lifestyle websites and blogs, Raffles Marina has been described as one of the most ideal and unique venues among couples for wedding photography and nautical themed weddings.

During the evenings, soak in the expanse of the beautiful sunset right at the sea as you take a stroll down the pier to the lighthouse. No wonder this icon is known to many as one of the most picturesque in Singapore!

Visit Raffles Marina Lighthouse, opens daily from 7am to 12am.
results.admissionInfo: Free admission. Simply identify and register yourself at the security post before entering the club premise.
results.description: Located at the tip of our Club's breakwater is Raffles Marina's own lighthouse. Built in 1994 and overlooking the Tuas Second Link - Singapore's second causeway to Malaysia, this 12 metres high icon flashes every 10 seconds with a beam that reaches 15 metres. The lighthouse is maintained by the Club and is the only lighthouse not owned and operated by the Maritime Port Authority of Singapore.
results.name: Raffles Marina Lighthouse

results.body: Whether a Broadway hit or West End offering, the Sands Theatre at Marina Bay Sands® brings the best shows under one roof for a world-class experience – think The Lion King, WICKED and MAMMA MIA!. The venue sits 2,155 across three levels, complete with plush seats and high-quality audio and visual equipment. Complement your experience with one of the integrated resort’s show packages for a sumptuous meal or hotel stay after.

reviews.text: Amazing auditorium. The stage is large and ample. Seating with very good view of the stage from all levels, with the right elevation to not be obstructed by the person in front of you, unless you are unfortunate enough to have a rather tall lad sit in front of you. Acoustics are impeccable. The setting is very grand and truly fits the occasion. Looking forward to the next musical.

Sands Theatre balcony seats for the George Michael concert was just 60 dollars and i had a wonderful view. Contrary to what is thought, not every concert means paying through the nose.
Great audience. And the romantic saunter to the Theatre from the Helix Bridge is great foreplay. So proud to be a Singaporean!

I also found out the Theatre is hosting the musicals  Matilda in Feb  2019 and Phantom in late April to May.

I came here to watch The Lion King when it was out last month. This Theatre is very beautiful and I'd recommend any visitor to watch a theater here (if it is within your budget). The employees will gladly help you to take a picture at the theater poster and there's an organized line for it.

I am here to watch Lion King show. The theatre is very good. The sound system also very good. their lighting is great. Also the service is good. Their arrangement seating is also good. Although its depend to the people who,s watching. if the do know how to watch the show...not make noisy..and sit until block the audience behind
Went for The Lion King musical. Love the surround sound effects! Always go for stall seats for a greater theatrical experience. You never know when the cast will appear somewhere near you 😉

results.description: Whether a Broadway hit or West End offering, the Sands Theatre at Marina Bay Sands® brings the best shows under one roof for a world-class experience.
results.name: Sands Theatre

results.body: On the lobby level of the Fullerton Hotel is the Fullerton Heritage Gallery, which displays decade-old photographs, maps, stamps and philatelic materials that showcase the precinct’s rich history. The precinct is walking distance to Merlion Park and is also a popular spot to watch the Marina Bay fireworks display on occasions like National Day and New Year’s Eve. On the guided Fullerton Monument Tour, visitors will discover the rich history of the Fullerton Building, where Singapore’s General Post Office was once located.

reviews.text: Super! Have a walk around here. There’s plenty of food, drinks, cafe and a very good crowd. Love it.
Nice place to chill along Singapore landmark. Many nice restaurants and good scenery. It's a good place to watch laser show of Marina Bay Sands at night.

Great restaurant options with a view of the marina bay sands, have been to the Pelican & Overeasy Restaurant/ Bars here.  All the places have a great outdoor and a cool indoor seating, so choose depending on the time of day and the time of year.

Cozy shopping mall with a sea view and a stone's throw away from Merlion Park and the Jubilee Bridge - great places for tourists to take photographs of Marina Bay Sands and the sea. The shopping mall also has cafes like Starbucks and restaurants such as Little Sheep Hot Pot
Very very good place for a dinner and walk around the Bay Area after.

results.admissionInfo: Free
results.description: The Fullerton Heritage District showcases the precinct’s rich history and is also a popular spot to watch the Marina Bay fireworks display on occasions like National Day and New Year’s Eve.
results.name: The Fullerton Heritage Singapore

results.body: ArtScience Museum™

reviews.text: One place not to miss in Singapore. Relatively inexpensive, we went to the future exhibition only, however there was also a minimalist one on too. It was amazing, there were interactive kinetic digital exhibitions where people could interact with the projected images. You could also draw pictures, scan them in and they would be generated on the wall. Great for grown up travellers and also those with kids. Check out the light installation too!

Good place which displays art in way that you could have never thought before. It has different exhibits throughout the year, you can check the schedule before going. Friendly staff with easy and efficient ticketing options. Plus they have a cafe and a beautiful lily pond around. Must go.

It is one of the must go places in Singapore. This particular exhibit: the Future World is best for children. They have 2 interactive exhibit that the kids would surely love. The most breathtaking exhibit for me is the Crystal Galaxy, it really is a must see. It is like you're taken to another dimension.

We went for FUTURE WORLD - WHERE ART MEETS SCIENCE.

5 stars for children and 3 stars for adults. I am awed by the presentation, the level of advanced smart technology and how interactive the setting was. The price was a little steep but it was worth it.

The place however is more like a child’s world. For an adult, it is like a scratch of curiosity. Nonetheless, HIGHLY RECOMMENDED FOR A FAMILY OUTING.

One of the best touristic attraction in Singapore.  It's at Marina bay and close to many other amazing attractions. Its impressive architecture is itself a big attraction. Inside there are many interesting exhibition to all ages. Enjoy!

results.description: Art, science, culture and technology intersect at the world’s first ArtScience Museum™, a lotus-shaped building located within the integrated resort of Marina Bay Sands®. Major international touring exhibitions have passed through, thanks to collaborations with the likes of the Natural History Museum of London, Japanese art collective teamLab, and jewellery brand Van Cleef & Arpels.
results.name: ArtScience Museum™

results.body: Spectra – A Light and Water Show

reviews.text:
Spectra how much I love YOU!!!!

WOW, what a breathtaking and mindblowing kind of show.

This is definitely any type of water show, the music, the colors, the lights, and everything else made this a wonderful show.

We went twice and if it wasn't I was sick, we would have gone 4 times.

I loved it so much, it made me happy and I got such a positive vibe out if it.

This show is located on the water and you can watch it from the main entrance of the Shops at Marina Bay Sands.

A very nice laser show. They spray water into the air and project videos in that water. You can hear music and all in all it is a very nice show. Make sure you come early as there are many people who want to see that and if you are stuck in the crowd you do not see much. The show takes about 15 minutes and they do it twice per evening.

I was in owe while watching the light show. A spectacular night to remember.   I think I almost cried just by watching this water light dances. This will just melt your heart. A night you should not miss and did I mentioned?? it's FREE.

The Light show was extremely well orchestrated and thoroughly entertaining. Perfect for the family. Fantastic location. Well worth the visit.

Don't forget to give this a thumbs up 👍 if you found it helpful.

An amazing sound and light show in the water. About 20 to 30 minutes, but you are like hypnotized, so beautiful forms of water, lighted and additionally figures are projected into it. One of the absolute musts when in Singapore. Held in the late evening. Go good 30 minutes before, in order to take a front seat. Free.

results.admissionInfo: Free
results.description: Gyroscopic arches, lava and mist effects and a 12-metre-high glass prism are only a slice of what to expect at Spectra, Marina Bay Sands’® light and water show that’s framed against the city skyline. The show takes place nightly on the Event Plaza along the promenade, featuring state-of-the-art lighting technology and colourful projections on the water foundations.
results.name: Spectra – A Light and Water Show

results.body: Digital Light Canvas

reviews.text:
Absolutely beautiful!

They have a nice circular stage in the food court with a huge and gorgeous chandelier, that plays music and the lights go on and off to the Rythm of the music.
The beautiful colors and images are reflected on the floor.

The entrance fee is just $5.00 and it's a great idea to do with your kids.
Yet another fantastic idea from Singapore. Best to view this after 1900 hours when it is dark. Pretend you are 6 years old and have a go.
Very nice place to spend time with your kid... you will be very joyful and tired to see your kid chassing the fish...
Free to enter if you bought artscience museum ticket

results.description: Break the boundaries of physical space at Marina Bay Sands’® interactive digital installation, Digital Light Canvas – a collaboration with Japanese art collective, teamLab. Race across the LED-lit floor and watch as calligraphic art blossoms in your wake, or be dazzled by the 20-metre-high light sculpture overhead that’s illuminated by over 400,000 lightbulbs.
results.name: Digital Light Canvas

results.body: Enter a world of perpetual spring! Replicating the cool and dry Mediterranean climate, Flower Dome showcases exotic plants from five continents which are displayed in nine different Gardens. Wander amongst thousand-year-old olive trees and unusual Baobabs as you take in sights of the Flower Field Display.
results.admissionInfo:
Standard Rate - Two Conservatories (Flower Dome and Cloud Forest)
Adult: $28
Child (3-12 years old): $15
results.description: Step into the Flower Dome and stand in awe of nature. Spectacular and innovative, it is the largest glass greenhouse in the world as listed in the 2015 Guinness World Records! Be amazed by changing display of flowers and plants from the Mediterranean and semi-arid regions.
results.name: Flower Dome at Gardens by the Bay

results.body: Explore the tropical highlands amidst orchids, pitcher plants and ferns from the cool-moist Tropical Montane region. Be amazed as you encounter the world's tallest indoor waterfall at 30 metres and descend through the surreal mist-filled Cloud Walk and Treetop Walk.
results.admissionInfo:
Standard Rate - Two Conservatories (Flower Dome and Cloud Forest)
Adult: $28
Child (3-12 years old): $15
results.description: Enter the Cloud Forest, a mysterious world veiled in mist. Take in breath-taking mountain views surrounded by diverse vegetation and hidden floral gems. And learn about rare plants and their fast-disappearing environment.
results.name: Cloud Forest at Gardens by the Bay

results.body: Measuring between 25 and 50 metres tall, Gardens by the Bay's Supertrees are designed with large canopies that provide shade in the day and come alive with an exhilarating display of lights and sounds at night. Stand in awe amidst these iconic giants, or stroll along the 22-metre-high OCBC Skyway and enjoy panoramic vistas of the Gardens and the Marina Bay skyline.
results.admissionInfo:
Standard Rate
Adult: $8
Child (3-12 years old): $5
results.description: Sitting 22 metres above ground, the OCBC Skyway was constructed to give visitors the unique sensation of floating above the ground.
results.name: OCBC Skyway, Gardens by the Bay

results.body:
Gardens by the Bay comprises three distinctive waterfront gardens – Bay South, Bay East and Bay Central.

Bay South, the largest of the three gardens, opened in 2012. With its award-winning cooled conservatories and iconic Supertrees, Bay South has placed Singapore squarely on the international map and is a source of national pride. Within Flower Dome, the ever-changing floral displays including crowd favourites such as Tulipmania, Orchid Extravaganza and Blossom Beats bring the beauty and diversity of the plant kingdom to life for all to enjoy.

While plant displays remain the focal point of Gardens by the Bay, engaging programmes and excellent service form key pillars in enhancing the Gardens’ overall visitor experience.

The Gardens’ calendar - filled with signature festivals, music concerts and movie screenings, sports and community events, and educational workshops and school programmes – draw a wide spectrum of visitors to the Gardens. With more than 50 million visitors to date, Gardens by the Bay continues to refresh and refine its offerings, to make the Gardens a place that everyone can enjoy – a green jewel where wonder blooms.

Bay East, the second largest, offers a tranquil respite from the bustling city and a stunning view of the Singapore skyline even as it unfolds over the next century. This green space is open to the public and has immense potential for future development as a waterfront garden.

Bay Central is the garden which will serve as a link between Bay South to Bay East when developed, with a 3km waterfront promenade boasting stunning views of the city.

reviews.text: One word  - 'Awesome'. It's a place that needs to be experienced....! It's amazing to see how beautiful these Gardens are and how many exotic variety of plants,  ferns,  cactus etc. Its like a rain forest itself..  Must visit place. There are two dome - 'cloud forest' and 'Flower Dome'.  In the end there there is a light show at the 'Super Tree Grove '. This will take about 5 hours min

An absolute can't miss in Singapore. My highlight of my recent visit.
gardens by the bay has a real otherworldly feel to it and is really unique. The super trees are a breathtaking site and placed in the centre of a large park - not something you'd expect in the middle of a large city. 
It's free to explore (although you'll have to pay if you want to visit the domes) and you can easily spend a day here. There's also a few cafes and a good court called satay by the bay which has lots of food options for a really good price.
Number 1 experience in Singapore and really easy to get to.

An architectural masterpiece.. Brilliant blend of nature & man made structures. Looks something out of a fantasy world, a must visit when in Singapore. You need to walk a lot, so if you plan to visit with kids or elders, better to opt for tram services. Keep yourself hydrated as you might sweat a lot in the hot & humid climate.

Wow, this place was better than I expected! I was thinking that I would be walking a while and since it was so hot in Singapore I expected to sweat quite a bit, wonderful surprise that these gardens are covered and have AC! That was awesome! It cost $28 SD to enter two of the gardens and they are well worth it. This place is definitely a must when you visit Singapore! It is truly beautiful!

In Singapore for sight seeing ?
Are you a nature lover ?
Want to experience a garden never seen before ?
Make your trip worth a memory ?

If yes for above then it’s a must visit place and your trip plan must definitely be scheduled. Click beautiful pictures here for your lifetime memory. Ensure you drink water frequently as there is a lot to walk and explore here. Overall it’s a good place to be with your family here.

results.description: A national garden and premier horticultural attraction for local and international visitors, Gardens by the Bay is a showpiece of horticulture and garden artistry that presents the plant kingdom in a whole new way, entertaining while educating visitors with plants seldom seen in this part of the world, ranging from species in cool, temperate climates to tropical forests and habitats.
results.name: Gardens by the Bay

results.body:
The Red Dot Design Museum presents a large collection of contemporary design works across disciplines including innovative products, research concepts, communication works and art. The current exhibition 'Human-Nature' questions the nature of being human in a world where we achieved enhanced abilities through technology and algorithm, where humans co-exist with robots, machine learning and big data.

In addition to design exhibitions, the museum features one of the best design shop, a design cafe and outdoor bar. Here, you can buy carefully curated design objects from around the world and also those produced by Singapore designers. The cafe features unique local deserts, craft beer, gourmet coffee and tea.

reviews.text: Amazing display of modern technology. Showcasing the tech from early 20th century up to now. Very cool place situated right beside the marina. The cafe is also good. You can buy some cold drinks perfect if its too hot outside. A lot of merchandise items are for sale also. You’d be very interested with the wide array of items being displayed.

Really nice find in the middle of loud and overcrowded with tourist area. Reasonable ticket price includes the current catalogue of Red Dot awarded designs. The exhibition might not look as very big, but when you dig into the descriptions and try to analyze the presented exhibits (not only their look, but taking design from the User Experience perspective), you are lost for an hour or so! Highly recommended.

I think this is the only museum in Singapore which opens till 2am midnight. Had a great time there! The atmosphere, interior and the product design are just perfect. I recommend you to buy the red dot design review book when you get there. Updated ones could be very expensive. But get the old one with very affordable price. If you are interested in design thinking, this is definitely a must place for you to go.

Love visiting the museum and their ever changing exhibitions! You'll be amazed at the Design talent waiting to be discovered. Worth checking out whether you're in the 'Bay area for shopping, food or just a stroll...in fact it's super hard to leave the Museum without buying something from the retail shop!

The Red Dot Museum is surprisingly small, but it has a lot of design information to learn about and take away from. I recommend to include this place in your itnerary if you're visiting Singapore and if you're interested in all things design! I ended up staying for an hour and a half just reading all write ups of the design projects. The location of the museum is quite good as well; there are a lot of places to sit and relax, and a nice surrounding area to take a stroll in.

results.admissionInfo:
Adult (13 years old and above): SGD11.80
Child (7 to 12 years old): SGD6.40
Free admission for children aged 6 and younger.
results.description: Contemporary Design Museum that presents award-winning good designs. Museum shop retails design products sourced from all over the world.
results.name: Red Dot Design Museum

results.body:
Introducing FLYER 360+, a multimedia in-capsule experience on Singapore Flyer that enhances the guests’ flight experience with its rich content on Singapore history, culture and iconic landmarks.

This elevates the guests’ experience inside the capsule by adding more interactive and educational elements, and also includes fun facts about Singapore Flyer.

Be treated to a visual 360˚ feast of iconic and historical landmarks 165 metres above the ground. Purchase your flight tickets online now!

Indulge in a multi-sensory dining experience with the Singapore Flyer Sky Dining or toast to the good things in life with the Premium Champagne Flight.

reviews.text: If you don't know what to do in your spare time on the trip, chose this flyer! One can't just go wrong with this. You get to see the mesmerizing  landscape of entire Singapore along with a guided interactive infotainment system.

A beautiful place surrounded by many shopping complexes....u can see the Singapore formula 1 track from here..........u can have a beautiful view from the flyer  to see the full city of Singapore. .a place worth the money
..and it has a maximum height of a massive 165 metres height....with special permission you can also dine here......u can even see parts of Malaysia and Indonesia clearly....if u visit singapore this is a must visit place
Nice and huge Ferris wheel in Singapore. A major tourist attraction. Can get a bird eye view of whole Singapore. The wheel rotates slowly and takes about 30-40 min to complete a rotation.
Great tourist attraction in Singapore! We went up at sunset, it was beautiful to watch the sun setting over the city. Would highly recommend!

It was really cool to be on the second tallest Ferris wheel in the world! It gave a great view of The Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Gardens By The Bay, the Art Science Museum, the Singapore city skyline and so much more as well. It was amazing to go on.

results.admissionInfo:
Singapore Flight
Adults: S$33
Child: S$21
Senior Citizens (Singaporeans and local residents only): S$24
results.description: A moving experience at every turn
results.name: Singapore Flyer

results.body: Formerly located in the Red Dot Traffic Building (now known as the Maxwell Chamber Suites), the Red Dot Design Museum is now housed along the Marina Bay Waterfront Promenade. Since 2005, the Red Dot Design Museum has displayed outstanding designs throughout its galleries, such as winners of the Red Dot Award (product design category), including a prototype of Google’s self-driving car. The museum also organises a Market of Artists and Designers (MAAD) for aspiring artists to sell items such as stationery, handicrafts and accessories. Visitors can look forward to special exhibitions such as ‘A Preview of the Future’ which displays over 300 award-winning futuristic design concepts over two floors.

reviews.text: Amazing display of modern technology. Showcasing the tech from early 20th century up to now. Very cool place situated right beside the marina. The cafe is also good. You can buy some cold drinks perfect if its too hot outside. A lot of merchandise items are for sale also. You’d be very interested with the wide array of items being displayed.

The location of the museum is quite good as well; there are a lot of places to sit and relax, and a nice surrounding area to take a stroll in.

pricing.others: Locals can pay as you wish. Minimum fee for non-Singapore citizen is S$6.40, Free admission for children aged six and below (for both local and non Singapore citizen)

results.description: A striking landmark, the museum features outstanding designs, such as winners of the Red Dot Award.
results.name: Red Dot Design Museum

reviews.text: Definitely worth visiting the Majestic Merlion.  This is much bigger than the Merlion in the main city. The view of the Merlion is surreal with water bodies surrounding it and lush green all around it. Must see if you are visiting Sentosa Island in Singapore. The island is the perfect destination for tourists especially.

Interior was nice on the ground level. The lucky token was a nice idea. The views were good but it was way too crowded and not worth the wait on the narrow stairway. The lucky bell was also way too loud for such a tiny confined space. I would recommend the cable car if you want views of the island.

Definitely come here during the weekdays.  Much less people and hence much easier to take pictures without tons of people around.   Then walk is nice as long as you come here in the afternoon while the sun is setting.  Sea breeze definitely helps to cool you down a bit.   Prepare to do tons of walking unless you are paying for the monorails.

This place was very enjoyable. Pay one time SGD $4 for the train to the island then you can travel free inside the island by train or tram. Everything here is just well designed, clean, beautiful and interesting.

Sentosa Merlion! A place to take a good couple of snaps and thats about it. Don’t even bother taking a trip up the top. There is nothing to see and a sheer waste of money. Usually there are some nice song and dance performance below near the Merlion monorail station

results.body:
Guardian of Prosperity

What does it take to guard the prosperity of Singapore? A 37 metre-tall mythical creature to be precise. If you think you’ve seen and heard it all, there’s more to the legend inside. Who knows, you could be in luck to uncover more than just curious tales upon making a grand entrance into the larger-than-life icon. Come and see, hear, touch, and feel the grand presence of the regal icon yourself.
results.admissionInfo:
Sentosa Merlion: $18.00 Adult $15.00 Child/Senior
Sentosa Merlion Guided Tour (Guided Tour timing: 11.45 am, 1.45 pm or 3.45 pm): $25.00 Adult $20.00 Child/Senior
Senior citizen aged 60 and above. Child aged 4- 12 years old.
results.description: If you think you know everything about the Sentosa Merlion, think again. Discover new trivia and learn how the Sentosa Merlion came to be the Guardian of Prosperity of Singapore at the only Merlion open for exploration!
results.source: MOUNT FABER LEISURE GROUP PTE. LTD.
results.name: Sentosa Merlion

reviews.text:
I step out into the jungle and explore a wilderness teeming with birds, insects, other wildlife and plants in all manner of different habitats.
Open at 9am - 5pm Daily.
Free admission
You will capture some green picture like me below :))

I love the nature walk.  You get to explore different kinds of plants n tree. And saw a few beautiful fountain. Is one of a good family or friends bonding activities. The workers there are friendly n without their hardwork to maintain all the tree n plants etc.  We wont get to enjoy the beautiful nature walk.  Love it.  💖💖💖
Nice quiet short walk away bustling scene of sentosa.
Very interesting. Practical knowledge about nature which we take for granted.i learned a lot.definately learnt a lot.
Very good place for kids to visit

results.body:
Get set for a hands-on journey of discovery and sharpen your detective skills. At Sentosa Nature Discovery, nature and fun go hand-in-hand.

The exploration starts with a fascinating gallery of interactive exhibits at the Gallery to brush up your Science Process Skills: Observe, Classify, Compare and Infer. Equipped with these skills, step out into the jungle and explore a wilderness teeming with birds, insects, other wildlife and plants in all manner of different habitats.

pricing.others: Free. For Guided Tours contact us at 1800- SENTOSA (736 8672) or email to nature@sentosa.com.sg

results.description: Embark on a hands-on journey of discovery and sharpen your detective skills. At Sentosa Nature Discovery, nature and fun go hand-in-hand.
results.name: Sentosa Nature Discovery

results.body: Hop on the Skyline Luge Sentosa for a unique go-karting experience, but not before taking the Skyride chairlift to the top of the Luge track, where a stunning view of Sentosa awaits. Once at the top, board the Luge and navigate over 600 metres worth of trails. Visitors can go at whatever speed they fancy—go daringly fast or cruise along at a leisurely pace. Age and height restrictions apply.

pricing.others: 2 Luge & Skyrides S$23.50; 4 Luge & Skyrides S$28; 6 Luge & Skyrides S$33; Child Doubling S$3 per ride (ride the Luge in tandem with an adult)

results.admissionInfo:
Skyride
Min. height 85cm to ride with an adult.
Min. height 135cm to ride alone.
Luge
Six years and 110cm or taller to ride
Luge alone.
results.description: Glide down the hills of Sentosa on a  toboggan the size of a go-kart at Skyline Luge.
results.name: Skyline Luge Sentosa

reviews.text: Really fun and cool to ride the SkyTram up and the Luge down. I especially recommend going at night. The Dragon Trail was the best in my opinion, but they were all good. I recommend trying all of them. Really fun and an experience you can’t miss.

Inordinately long ques.  Fantastic ride ends in a few seconds after waiting for about half an hour at least. Direction signage is very poor though presuming we would take the shuttle bus.  However the bus has a frequency of 10 - 15 minutes and the actual walking distance would be 5 minutes

It's really a place for families and friends to hang out, and experience the thrill of go-karting together!! The skyline luge is a good opportunity for one to catch a scenic view of Singapore and take a breather from all the stress :)

It was fun! Kudos especially to the fact that you can get all your photos (everyone in the group / family) for only $10. They will send to one email. This is way more economical than printing 1 or 2 photos for $20 at other attraction places. Amazed also that you can check your photos by scanning your helmet. Cheers to a good customer service!
One of the most fun rides I've ever experienced. The amazing speed makes you feel great! And you MUST go with your friends or family and enjoy together. Must see!

results.body: Skyline Luge is a unique wheeled gravity ride that provides riders full control over their descent on purpose-built track. Thrill-seekers can navigate the Jungle trail or challenge themselves on the Dragon trail - then try one of our two brand new Luge tracks - Kupu Kupu (638m) and Expedition (358m) that twist and turn through the mystical forest. Enjoy 2.6 kilometres of fun with your loved ones and feel the cool wind in your hair as you zoom down the tracks. As we always say... once is never enough.
results.companyDisplayName: Skyline Luge Sentosa Company Pte Ltd

pricing.others: 2 Luge + Skyride Combo ($23), 4 Luge + Skyride Combo ($28), 6 Luge + Skyride Combo ($39)

results.description: Skyline Luge Sentosa is the first-ever fun-filled gravity thrill ride introduced in Southeast Asia that’s safe for all ages, now with two thrilling new luge tracks and a brand new Skyride, offering multiple unique experiences not to be missed!
results.source: Skyline Luge Sentosa Company Pte Ltd
results.name: Skyline Luge Sentosa

reviews.text: Great resort island with lots of museums, amusement areas and shopping.  Excellent restaurants.  Clean and spacious.  Easy access to beach with water sports activities.  Quick access with tram, bus and private transportation.  Has nice hotels to stay.  Very safe.  Great customer services.  Beautiful landscape with jogging and biking trails.  Lots of shading areas and rest stops.
Excellent!! Amazing!! Once in a lifetime experience. It is a must visit kind of place. We enjoyed ourselves thoroughly. Kids had so much fun there. They have made it something like heaven on earth!!
Location is perfect. Cleanliness is good. However, staff is not polite as compare to other five star resort. Don't have much veg option.. Overall value for money..

Sentosa hosts almost all the main tourist attraction spots. We had visited adventure cove water park continued with 8pm show of crane dance. Both were amazing. For water park would suggest to bring your towels. To attend crane dance show better be there 10-15 minutes before show timing. It’s a free show loaded with fireworks.

What an amazing place to explore. The huge main plaza not only connects people to the theme parks Adventure Cove and Universal, but has a selection of restaurants and shops. There is also another level below everything of more shops to encounter. There is also an infusion of Americana in this area near Universal and the Hard Rock Hotel.

results.body: Integrated Resort
results.description: Resorts World Sentosa is home to some of Singapore’s leading attractions: the S.E.A. Aquarium (one of the world’s largest oceanariums), Universal Studios Singapore (Southeast Asia’s first and only Universal Studios theme park), the Maritime Experiential Museum, and the Dolphin Island and Adventure Cove Waterpark. Other attraction offerings include the Trick Eye Museum, featuring various optical illusion artworks and installations, and the Crane Dance, a pyrotechnic light and water show that is displayed at the Waterfront nightly. Covering an area of 49 hectares, the integrated resort also offers diverse accommodation options across its six hotels, myriad celebrity chef restaurants and dining experiences, varied retail offerings, a casino, a convention centre, and an award-winning spa.
results.name: Resorts World Sentosa

reviews.text: One of my favorite places in Sentosa. The flowrider is one of the best I've used. The instructors are super friendly and really great at teaching you to use it. The bar itself is quite nice. Very good food and drinks.

Very fun as a first timer. How much you learn depends on the instructor you get. My instructor seemed aloof at first but started sharing tips after a few failed attempts. Go early to avoid a packed class, which reduce your number of tries. There were 6 in my class and i did around 7 tries, more than I expected!
Lots of fun. Mentors are good and very attentive. Just prepare to be sore at the end of it especially if you fall often.

It's great fun to ride these artificial waves and there's only a few of them around the world.
The only thing that seriously spoiled the fun were the guys operating the attraction (you couldn't call them 'instructors'): they were pretty uninterested, tired of their job, counting their precious time till their next break, like they wished they were somewhere else. 
Too bad because this attraction was pretty pricey.
Nice beach time. Good music, could be quieter. Order food only if you are extremely hungry.

results.body: Wave House Sentosa, the most iconic in a global family of Wave House venues, is the place to experience the Californian beach lifestyle with high-adrenaline flowboarding on The Double FlowRider® which is the more gentler of the two waves and 10-foot FlowBarrel® which create the perfect endless barreling wave rides! Chill out to the beat of awesome music as you savor modern Californian– Asian cuisine at the Wave House Sentosa Restaurant + Bar or cool off from the tropical heat at our Beach Bars. All these spread across its idyllic 70,000 square feet tropical beachfront setting at Siloso Beach, Sentosa.

pricing.others: The Double FlowRider: S$35/hr for weekday, S$40/hr for weekend. FlowBarrel: S$30/30 mins for all days.

results.description: Experience the Californian beach lifestyle with high-adrenaline flowboarding on the world famous Double FlowRider® and 10-foot FlowBarrel® wave rides!
results.name: Wave House Sentosa

reviews.text: One of the best place in Singapore where you can spend your half day. The place is so beautiful diet you fall in love with it. This place is very beautifully decorated with trees and plants and flowers. You can also fine food stalls near.

Very informative & friendly, helpful staff. Interactive & plenty to see for the kids. Loved the iguana petting, close up viewing of macaws (not in cages) and the abundance of butterflies. Also loved holding the butterflies. Great static displays of butterfly growth stages & insects. Recommend allowing up to 2 hours for a thorough visit.
Nice park where everyone can enjoy time discovering butterflies literally flying everywhere. The staff is great and ready to explain and take time to talk. A bit short though.

Visited Butterfly Park and Insect kingdom at Sentosa, Singapore this January with my family. My kids particularly enjoyed the park very much. They had the opportunity to release new born butterflies. The old iguana specially attracted them the most. The butterfly museum was also awesome.

It is an awesome sight to see how the pupas transform into butterflies. We had an enjoyable time at the gallery too where we get to see different specimen species if butterflies, beetles and insects .

results.body: Located in Singapore's Sentosa Island, surrounded with lush tropical greenery, Butterfly Park & Insect Kingdom showcases the stunning beauties of a different variety of beautiful butterflies and interesting insects.
results.companyDisplayName: BUTTERFLY PARK & INSECT KINGDOM PTE LTD
results.description: Butterfly Park Sentosa
results.source: BUTTERFLY PARK & INSECT KINGDOM PTE LTD
results.name: Butterfly Park & Insect Kingdom

reviews.text: Good show. It's laser light projected on a screen and water curtain. Kids usually enjoy. Not bad for adults also. The most exciting part usually is the fireworks
Amazing, simply a marvel to behold. It's aimed at children but fun for the whole family and visitors of all ages. I won't ruin the show for you 🙃

Wow what a show. The atmosphere and location as well as the amazing performance surpassed my expectations on all levels. Still reeling from how surreal it all was. Anyone visiting Singapore, please do yourself a favor and buy a ticket to this show. Perfect for all ages, especially children. It will not dissapoint!

Wings of time is one of the must see attraction if visiting Sentosa Island. It is light and sound show on water. Try to reach early to grab good seats. When you purchase tickets you get 3 coupons in which you get popcorn, hand fan and discount on some drinks. There are 2 show timings. There is lot of rush to catch monorail after the show ends.

It is one of the best experiences on can get here ...It's too fabulous. I have got no words to describe it. I highly recommend this for all of you. I wanted to take some vids  but rather did not as I wanted my complete attention on the act.

results.body: A timeless story of friendship and discovery comes to life with Wings of Time. Join Shahbaz, a mystical pre-historic bird, and his friends as they travel across beautiful landscapes and journey through the mysteries of time. Be enthralled by the Singapore’s award winning outdoor night show that combines dazzling water, laser, and fire effects, set to an original music score against the backdrop of an open sea.
results.admissionInfo: Wings of Time (7.40 pm and 8.40 pm): $18.00 (Standard Seat) $23.00 (Premium Seat)
results.description: Voted #1 Show in Sentosa by TripAdvisor
results.source: MOUNT FABER LEISURE GROUP PTE. LTD.
results.name: Wings of Time

reviews.text: Unfortunately the cable car is too hot. I asked the staff before the doors of the cable car closed if it would cool down. They said yes the fan is on. Well it didn't. I used my hand fan but that wasn't enough. When I reached the Sentosa stop I went to the ticket counter and asked for a refund for the return. I was told that I couldn't receive a refund because, I rode the cable car. Of course I wouldn't have ridden it if the staff had said the temperature would NOT cool down. I don't like to post non-positive reviews but, as a traveler this is information I would have found important before I had made my decision to take the Singapore Cable Car.

Get round trip tickets for value for money ! That way, you can explore the island on foot and hop on the cable car when the feet starts to ache. The souvenir shops are awesome..the gifts sold are thoughtful and cater to all ages, from a foldable walking cane to plush toys for the young ones! If only there was a commentary in the cable car, it would be even better!

It was an unique thrilling experience of riding by a cable car. We bought round tickets which helped us to explore many stations on ground including Sentosa island. Sentosa Island has many transport modes of reaching from the Mainland. 

There are many attractions at each of the stations including restaurants and tourists’ facilities. Beautiful picturesque surroundings and one can take lot of photos for remembrance. We thoroughly enjoyed the cable car ride.

Very nice experience. A must visit for tourists. One of the ways to enter Sentosa island. Make sure you cover all the stations and morning and evening times. Do visit Faber peak as cable car is the fastest and easiest way to go there. It runs till 9:30 in night so plan accordingly.

Very friendly team. I have been there twice and the experience is next to none. Plenty of staffs and ask them as many questions as you want and they will assist you with anything. 
Supports available for disabled tourists. 
Public transport access available which is under the shopping mall. 
If you are planing to visit Sentosa island then you must experience this.

results.body:
Experience Faber Peak Singapore and Sentosa with Cable Car Sky Network

Get onboard the Cable Car Sky Network, a fun way to fly from Singapore’s only hilltop destination, Faber Peak Singapore, to over 20 attractions in Sentosa! Soar high above for priceless views of the exciting island, golden beaches and beautiful greenery. Catch this unique joyride on the Mount Faber Line and the Sentosa Line.

reviews.text: Very fun place with several daring stunts while not having to worry about safety. The staff is very attentive and always puts your safety ahead of everything. Buy a package as you get to save lots of money vs. buying each of the stunts individually. The zip-line is particularly very fun and is a must-do.

The staff is truly nice and committed in making your experience memorable. I underestimated the climb and chickened out. But I was able to do the jump and zip which were exciting and a memory to keep forever. Just one thing I didn’t like the quality of the photos printed that they made. Though my experience was near to perfect.

I loved doing all the Mega Adventures! All the staff were warm, welcoming, constant smile on their faces, couldnt have done more for you! The highlight was the zip line and the climbing obstacle. The views as you flew over the beach, along with the thrill. They took great action photo shots of us. A free water fountain is available for a drink,they have a shop nearby for nibbles if needed. You can purchase a phone case to take pictures yourself as your doing the adventures. Great memories! Ill certainly be back with more friends and family when they come to visit Singapore! Thank you so much!

An incredible experience, can’t recommend highly enough. It’s absolutely worth doing all the activities and the photos (purchase optional) are incredibly high quality. 
An absolute must-do if you’re going to Singapore!
It was a fun experience. The staff there are very friendly people and the whole course was fun and has a unique feel. I recomend this to anyone who wanna have a good day hanging out with friends

results.body: Mega Adventure Park is located on the picturesque Sentosa Island, host to Singapore’s main attractions. Mega Adventure operates the MegaZip - Asia's No. 1 zipline, that spans 450m, where you fly at 60kph over the jungle and beaches of the Island. Furthermore, there are 3 additional activities that include a 36-obstacle treetop ropes course (MegaClimb), a 15m free fall simulator (MegaJump), and a rock-climbing wall (MegaWall). Suitable for the entire family, this is a must do for all adventure seekers!
results.admissionInfo: Buy your tickets online and get 10% off all packages: https://sg.megaadventure.com/buy-tickets
results.description: Mega Adventure Park is located on the picturesque Sentosa Island, host to Singapore’s main attractions. Mega Adventure operates Asia’s #1 zipline - the 450m MegaZip, where you fly at 60kph over the jungle and beaches of the Island. Furthermore, there are 3 additional activities that include a 36-obstacle treetop ropes course (MegaClimb), a 15m free fall simulator (MegaJump), and a rock-climbing wall (MegaWall). Suitable for the entire family, this is a must do for all adventure seekers!
results.name: Mega Adventure Park

reviews.text:
Here is your chance to really fly. Experience true free-fall conditions, just like a real skydive. Each flyer will enjoy two skydives in the wind tunnel. The time it takes for each skydive is like falling through the air from 12,000 to 3,000 feet! And at one-fifth the cost of a tandem jump, iFly Singapore is unbeatable value.

We are beside the Beach Station, down at Siloso Beachfront in Sentosa, Singapore. The Beach Station is a focal point for all transports including Sentosa buses, trams, trains and taxis. Should you wish to drive, there are over 600 parking lots located at the basement of the station.

For your convenience and enjoyment, we are pleased to offer a variety of F&B tenants within iFly Singapore itself.

One of the best experience for those who want to do the simulation of sky diving.
Actual sky diving is definitely not that comfortable as this one. This is safe, fun, short duration and expensive.
Expensive because of short duration 😜. 
The trainer was good and briefed everyone well before the session.
The flying experience is really good. One should have no back/shoulder injuries. If you do then it's dangerous for you.
Do a little stretching before the flying session. This helps!

Overall great experience so definitely 5 Starts.
Experience flight for a minute. It is great for first timers and the guides are experts. They make it look so easy. They give you a video of the action for 110 sgd.

Enough for kids and mindless amusement: a bit unprofessional if you really want to learn and do well.

The training session was too superficial and rushed, so had a lot of questions once in the tunnel. No break to ask once inside.

Needless to say, no stretching or muscle activation to prevent injuries, only a waiver about existing back problems. I'm an active person with no preexisting issues and I had a pinch on my back the night after.

Once in the tunnel, not sure how they calculated the time but I left without really knowing what to improve. Instead: the instructor performed a fancy demonstration to upsell additional time, sessions and pics, without letting me out.

After most people bought and used additional time, we still finished early... It was amusing but I was expecting better tips.

I was here on the 1st of December, 2018.  It was a first visit. What struck me as awkward was the simulated training session. Also, they do not mention the importance of having to completely cover your hair. Not kidding, but I spent 2 whole days trying to entangle my hair and almost went crazy! Had to pull them apart strand by strand and now my hair is in shackles ! 

Make sure you ask a lot of questions before doing the actual sky-dive. 

The experience was pretty good. And is a superb simulation of the wind pressure up there. Other than that, it's not worth so much of your money... (And a lot of hair!!)

results.body: To live out the dream of soaring like a superhero, drop by iFly Singapore, Southeast Asia’s largest wind tunnel for indoor skydiving. The 18-foot-tall acrylic ‘glass walls’—allow visitors to enjoy panoramic views of the South China Sea and Siloso Beach. State-of-the-art technology will lend visitors wings in an experience that gives visitors a taste of skydiving and simulates free falls from heights of 12,000- to 3,000-feet. First timers needn’t fret, as trained professionals will be on hand to guide them.

pricing.others: 1 Skydive S$89; 2 Skydives S$119 (walk-in); 2 Skydives S$109 (2 day in advance online rate); 2 Skydives S$89 (2 day in advance online off-peak rate)

results.description: Enjoy skydives in wind tunnels for an unforgettable experience.
results.name: iFly Singapore

reviews.text: Great cycling around sentosa. Staff could have been more attentive as we were only visitors and were asked to chose a bike and sort out ourselves. My experience elsewhere in Singapore is that staff would have helpfully come over and helped out. Notwithstanding this give it a go but be careful of purchasing drink from beach front bars as very expensive.

Offering Longer rides won't do u any loss Sentosa. 

But a great experience over all.

Risky and not worth it. 

The entire island is beautiful and full of attractions to keep you going for the entire day. 

However, the Segway Tour with this company gave me my worst experience as a tourist last July 2018.  My Segway stopped working , I fell at the middle of the tour and NOONE helped me. Their staff left me alone bleeding at the side of the road where I fell. They were more concerned about the Segway that stopped working than on me. 

Noone knew how to do first aid and they did not have facilities for such. I was led to this dark alley where I had to wash my wounds and do my own first aid with the little supplies that they had. 

Their supervisor, MUHD YUSUF, was not helpful. I called for the supervisor three times but he was arrogant enough to ignore that an accident happened. No one showed any concern and no one apologised. There was this one female staff who offered to help me but I did not allow her because she did not even wash her hands not wore gloves before handling my wound dressings. 

For the rest of my lifetime, I'll have these scars on my elbow  and knee to remind me of this company's bad service. I don't mind getting wounded, but it just frustrating to receive bad customer service and poor treatment.

I reported about this incident to Sentosa Management, and no one replied. GoGreen is a designated first aid station for the island, yet it had no facilities or staff with skills to provide such service. 

Join this tour at your own risk. It's expensive and not worth at all. If you injure yourself, you are to be left to your own.
Too expensive for me. Not the best what you can do in Singapore...

A must do.    Very pleasant staff and no mucking around to get you going.   The safety brief was simple and operating instruction had a full demonstration which helped us out immensely.     We were first-timers, so after a bumpy start, we loved very second of this experience.   What a great way to get around in such a limited timeframe.   We saw so much that we could go around nearly a second time in the hour provided.  The walkways are also so smooth and segway-friendly which allows for constant riding.   Word of warning:   you need to share the pathways with unpredictable selfie-addicts so expect them to do anything in front of you as they are totally unaware that you are there.   Enjoy.

results.body: The ever popular Segway Fun Ride is an introductory experience that is suitable for everyone. Our friendly trainer will teach you how to ride the Segway Personal Transporter (PT) in a fun and easy way.
results.description: Learn how to ride the Segway Personal Transporter.
results.name: Go Green Segway

reviews.text: Great self-guided walking tour on the island. Was able to take a break from the beach and see some history. If you don't mind hills, steps and learning, I would recommend this to you. After the fort you can continue walking on the nature trails or make your way back to the beach areas easy.

This fort is a really cool place to learn a little about Singapore history. There you can feel the immersion of struggle of war days. Old cannons, barracks, small chambers... really show the definition of a fort.

The place is quite huge with lots of paths, but fear not, because you will be greeted with maps and guide boards that will show you 3 available trails to explore this fort!

It's nice to take an hour walk here ,it's totally free! Bring water with you,maybe a hat or umbrella.You can go inside the actual bunkers and here audio tracks of soldiers (actors) .If you are interested in the history of Singapore and WW2 this is a ace for you.

Very nice museum about Singapore during wartime. Three different routes can be followed, each with their specific attention points. It was very quiet when I visited. Most people tend to stay on the recreational side of the island. Must see if you're interested in WW2 history.
A well depicted piece of history.. well maintained and more importantly provides a great view of the ocean.. well schedule l accessible.

results.body:
Fort Siloso was built in the late 19th century. During that time, Singapore had become an important trading port for the British, so it was imperative that the island was protected from sea invasion.

However, during World War II, Japanese troops invaded Singapore by land from north Malaya. This led the British to turn Fort Siloso's guns towards the mainland instead to help support the ground forces defending Singapore from the invasion.

Today, more than 70 years after the war, Fort Siloso stands as a beloved historical site. The only preserved coastal fort in Singapore, it is home to a wealth of WWII memorabilia, including coastal guns and the remains of fortified military structures and tunnels.

Begin your exploration from the Fort Siloso Skywalk, a treetop trail set 11 storeys above ground. You may also choose to explore the fort by the Heritage Trail or the Gun Trail, both of which are sure to take you on an unforgettable journey back in time.

Relive some of the momentous events in Singapore's history with the Surrender Chambers immersive show. Be guided by light, sound and video effects starting from the Japanese invasion, all the way to the Japanese's eventual surrender at the end of WWII.

Let yourself be transported back in time through the stories of people who lived during the Japanese Occupation, and experience the Allied forces' counterattack and the end of the war through six interactive zones. Before you leave, share a message of peace on the wall of poppies.
results.description: Fort Siloso was built in the late 19th century. During that time, Singapore had become an important trading port for the British, so it was imperative that the island was protected from sea invasion.
results.name: Fort Siloso

reviews.text: The bird's are treated in a very good  manner, They follow the instructions properly.🐦🐧🕊️🦉🦃
Cute animals. Avoid the aggresive one. Watch out ur stuff and kids.
Cute animals. Be aware of peacock walking on the street
Animal and Bird Encounters

results.body:
Come down to the Palawan Amphitheatre to see awesome displays of intelligence, agility and responsiveness from our animal friends.

Nimble monkeys, amazing reptiles and colourful parrots all get in on the act!

Daily shows at 2pm, 3pm, 4pm and 5pm.
results.description: Come down to the Palawan Amphitheatre to see awesome displays of intelligence, agility and responsiveness from our animal friends.
