reviews.text:
Beautiful place !
One must visit when in Singapore 
Take a bus or local transport to Sentosa islands. 
This is one of the nice places in Singapore. 
Good local food available - one must try special coconut ice cream. 
Place for all age groups 
Clear water beach

Unbelievable, such a peaceful paradise next to this gigantic glamorous city. Even so the extraordinary beautiful beaches. I strongly recommend going there. An advice in advance, go there(Singapore in general) by plane and not per bus, because of the drug smugglers and the death sentence on drug possession.

If you’re on Santosa island then you should absolutely go. Nice rope bride over and then there are 2 observation towers that overlook the ocean littered with tankers and cargo boats. Literally nothing else. I wouldn’t go just for this though.
Such a nice place to catch sunset and enjoy the good view of Palawan. It’s kinda fun walking on the swinging bridge if there weren’t too many ppl. Highly recommended.

Leading to this point is a rope bridge that is fun and sways left and right. There are two towers and climbing up to the top can present stunning views of the sea. Catch the sunset here after a day at the beach.

results.body:
Stand at the edge of continental Asia right on Palawan Beach! Accessible via a suspension bridge, the Southernmost Point of Asia is a tiny islet that promises a unique setting for special occasions and unforgettable encounters.

From hosting Amazing Race-style teambuilding activities to exclusive chill-out parties by the beach, the Southernmost Point of Asia's location makes it the ideal destination for the extraordinary. For a more casual experience, simply take a stroll down to the Southernmost Point of Asia and enjoy the refreshing sea breeze and gorgeous scenery. Flanked by two viewing towers, the timber viewing deck offers an endless view of the South China Sea.
results.description: Stand at the edge of continental Asia right on Palawan Beach!
results.name: Southernmost Point of Continental Asia

results.body:
The 11-storey, 181 meters long Skywalk trail provides guests a scenic trek among the treetops en route to Fort Siloso.

Both the Skywalk and Fort Siloso are free for all, and there are also guided tours at Fort Siloso for a more detailed historical account of the area.
results.description: The 11-storey, 181 meters long Skywalk trail provides guests a scenic trek among the treetops en route to Fort Siloso.
results.name: Fort Siloso Skywalk

reviews.text: Great for a free attraction, attendants are friendly and very good at managing the public and advising of impending thunderstorms. Pool is showing signs of significant wear and tear, sadly this means it is due to close soon

Great for taking your kids. Dynamic, safe,  FREE (well,  discounting transport to get to Dentist), you can't go wrong. Some of the fittings are getting a bit worn and not functioning well,  but that's a small concern.
Kids absolutely loved this place! It's a pity it will be closing soon. Thanks for the memories!
Nice place to bring kids out for some waterplay and picnic. A bit too hot in the mid of the day. To be closed soon in Apr 2019.
Wonderful place if you're visiting Sentosa with kids. We had really great time there. Slides are awsome,  many fountains, valves that that kids can play and let water flow in different directions.

results.body:
A water play area designed for children aged 3-10 years old, the Palawan Pirate Ship is free for guests to splash around and have fun as a family!

After a day of fun in the sun, take a break in our sheltered rest areas and benches located nearby.
results.description: A water play area designed for children aged 3-10 years old, the Palawan Pirate Ship is free for guests to splash around and have fun as a family!
results.name: Palawan Pirate Ship

reviews.text: This one is Must Visit. They have a very unique way of telling you the story of Singapore. Actors are good. Its like a live drama where you are involved in it.

Very informative live show from hosters. Speech given by them was really appreciatable. Speech and voice modulation from them will attract children's as well. I see the hostress are very young but their way of presenting the story will make you to listen the Singapore story.

Worst experience ever!!

I have never written any bad reviews online for anything but this experience is very disappointing! 

We were in group of four , 1 adult, one toddler, 1 kid and 1 elderly. 

We bought our tickets on Sentosa website. However we were treated very rudely at the entrance ( like that we didn’t want to pay ?!) and we were shouted at by a staff in front of at least 30 people. 

The entrance counter was badly managed and it was a mess . They took some tickets from us and let us in . Then later they realised they needed another set of tickets from us. 

A member of staff , a lady in white shirt was very rude and sarcastic to us . She and a few member of staffs are unable to empathise customers (my toddler was crying as they wanted me leave the queue and find the right set of tickets , isn’t that their responsibility to get it right the first time before I entered?!)

This experience leave us a very bad impression of Sentosa and even Singapore. 

The show itself was forced and acting was bad. Thirty minutes is a big waste of time. 

Use your time and money to visit other attraction !

Will not visit again ! Bad experience

We bought our tickets via Sentosa website. The redemption of tickets are troublesome , needed to queue up in 3 different places in order to finally get into the museum . 

We have a toddler with stroller. Before the redemption of tickets , there were nobody (at 3 different queues , they all saw us with stroller ) told us that stroller is not allowed . Only after we redempted our tickets then they said no stroller is allowed , which is very inconvenient for us as my toddler won’t able to walk long way. They should have put a notice in front or at least let us know before we redempt our tickets . 

The staff at the entrance is not efficient too. They let our family in , after we walked quite a long way (without stroller holding my toddler) they suddenly told me they forgot to take my recipt earlier! (I was so confused that aren’t they supposed to take it while I was walking in) I had to walk all the way back to outside the building to the stroller to get the receipt that they needed to keep for record. 

There was a lady (I believe she is the manger of the front staffs) was very rude to us too. It is definitely not what I expected in Sentosa which is a tourist place that staffs there should be polite and welcoming. Big disappointment! 

The acting of staff inside the museum is over-acting and the 30 mins acting was quite boring. I would prefer either they just tell us the history or I can read it on the wall myself. Basically you are forced to sit through the 30 mins bad acting . There is a sign said once you are in, you cannot exit half way. I wanted to leave as soon as I walked in. 

Will not recommend this place as it just not worth wasting time.
Perfect place to know the history of Singapore in brief.special mention to Mr Lee for giving detailed explanation of Singapore history.

results.body: Images of Singapore LIVE employs actors and special effects to construct a narrative of Singapore’s history from 1819 to the present day. During the 45-minute character-guided tour, visitors can interact with the guide and gain insights into Singapore’s history through 15 interactive areas. The tour ends with the Spirit of Singapore Boat Ride, during which iconic landmarks and the founder of modern Singapore, Sir Stamford Raffles, make an appearance.

pricing.others: Adult: (13-59 years old) S$39, Child: (3-12 years old) S$29

results.description: Watch actors and special effects construct a narrative of Singapore’s history from 1819 to the present day.
results.name: Images of Singapore LIVE

reviews.text: Quite an interesting place to be. You can easily spend about 2-3 hours here going from one room to the other taking pictures. Definitely worth a place where toi should go with a company.  Recommended to wear comfy footwear as you need to walk here. Vibrant and colourful! Lifts up your mood with its witty ideas

Very good experience. Worth the money paid. 
 Good quality camera is must to get the photos more realistic. Won't recommend going alone, go with team or at least with one extra person with you.

Place is ideal for kids and adults who are crazy about getting insta friendly pics and only for pics .. Use of a AR app is must to get those kind of pics we see which people share . Make it a point to  keep your phone's fully charged as the AR app drains your battery in minutes, better keep a battery pack to charge in need. If you need to fill in for some extra time then pack this attraction in your schedule , else you got better attractions and experiences worth your time .

A nice treat to all the illusion lovers.. amazing work of trick for the eye. I have seen elders enjoying more than the kids.. they also have a inhouse app that makes the photo very dramatic and lively. It would take 1 to 1.5 hr for the entire session, but worth one visit. This is located at the main entrance of Sentosa, so don't miss it.

Liked the museum especially with the augmented reality view. Interesting place. A lot to do and experience. A word of advice, take multiple power banks to keep mobile charged.

We realized, after more than 200 photos that the phone batteries were going dead and then had to leave some photo scenes

And you will end up taking the same amount ot photos. Extremely engaging esp through the Augmented reality app.

Must see and highly recommended

results.body: Get ready to let your imagination run wild in Trick Eye Museum Singapore, an internationally renowned 3D art museum from Korea. With its huge array of art exhibits hand-painted by dedicated Korean artists, each exhibit comes alive with the use of a special art technique that makes 2D art pop up into 3D. Feel, touch and interact with the exhibits in 6 different zones, and enjoy a day filled with fun, laughter, adventure and excitement. With Trick Eye Museum’s very own Augmented Reality mobile app, you will discover a hidden world of Augmented Reality seen only through the app. Download the “Trickeye” app and watch as your photos and videos come alive with hidden animals, magic, fireworks and other special effects!
results.admissionInfo:
Adults (13-59 yrs) $25, Child (4-12 yrs) $20, Senior (60 yrs above) $20.

Open daily from 10am to 9pm (last admission 8pm)
results.description: Singapore's First 3D + AR Museum
results.name: Trick Eye Museum Singapore

results.body: Chinatown Street Market re-creates the street hawking of yesteryear with 140 stalls offering a wide array of Singapore-centric and themed souvenirs, apparels, arts and crafts. Walking down the bustling downtown of Pagoda Street, Sago Street, Smith Street, and Trengganu Street transports you to an old era of Singapore. Scour through these streets with stall offerings in which reflects Chinatown’s heritage tells little known stories of Chinatown’s rich and vibrant culture. Experience a glimpse of Chinese culture unique to Singapore at Chinatown today.

reviews.text: Full of people, houses, stores, fast food restaurants, at places - interesting architecture; Chinese lanterns all over. Well worth a visit to soak up in Far Eastern culture, though in Singapore everything is a little bit different ... When we visited, it was the Chinese New  Year, so a lot of decorations were spread all over.

Not the usual Chinatown around the world.  It's not as dirty since its Singapore.  Food market is now closed but the street is still packed with varieties of option.  Shop around if you're looking for souvenirs.  Price difference between shops are common. Overall it's a nice to spend 3 hours there.

Good place for buying souvenir and having NON VEG Chinese food and other foods. Mainly Beef, pork, duck, various sea foods, etc. Buddha Tooth Relic is a good Buddhist temple in China town. Many shops are wholesale kind.

So many food options! And outdoor covered seating which is nice. Take a walk around and find something that suits your tastes! It can get a little busy but just don't worry and you'll be eating in no time. Lots of gift shops with junk as well.
Focus on the tourist is noticeable from every corner but even with that it's still unique and worth visiting. Try to go to hawker center there after sunset. There's little pub to discover.

results.description: A vibrant one stop destination for interesting and diverse shopping, dining and entertainment.
results.name: Chinatown Street Market

results.body: Chinatown Visitor Centre is a one-stop service centre that can help in planning your day. Attractions and tours can all be booked at the Visitor Centre efficiently. With professional guides to assist you on which are the popular attractions, where to go and even help you plan up a fun and memorable itinerary. What’s more, tickets sold in the Chinatown Visitor Centre are at discounted price. The Visitor Centre also retail souvenirs and merchandise that reflect the cultural aspects of Chinatown. And, there’s FREE Wi-Fi around the whole of Chinatown for everyone!

reviews.text: Must visit Buddha temple here. Peaceful. I bought lot of souvenier from the local shops here. Great for street shopping
more chioce there. good food and so on.
You can get quite useful information here.
Prices are not a low as expected, though it is a clean place.
Very bad attitude of the guy staff when we enquire about the Merlin plushie. Really disappointed with the Chinatown visitor centre. We felt locals are not welcomed.

results.description: Your One Stop Service Centre!
results.name: Chinatown Visitor Centre

results.body: This is where visitors can trace the footsteps of Singapore’s early pioneers and discover the personal stories of people who made Chinatown their home. Housed in three adjacent restored shophouses along Pagoda Street, the Chinatown Heritage Centre is a museum that offers insights into the lives of early migrants from China, who left their villages and travelled to Singapore in hopes of a better life.

reviews.text: Great place to spend for shopping and food. Two hours will already be enough. I have not tried haggling but I don't think you still need to do it. The prices are reasonable. Aside from that you could also enjoy the view around the area. There are temples, open area for live events. It's definitely one area you should not miss when you visit Singapore.

Lots of China shops with apparel n accessories. But the products slightly varies across these shops, though there are few stores with unique accessories. There is one for street of eateries serving completely non veg dishes with sea food etc. It's colorfully decorated street though.

This is a great museum - thoughtfully curated with lots of detail and interesting background information. Each floor of the house is laid out the way it would have been in the early 20th century and provides you with insight into the lives being led there. The audio guide adds extra colour.
It's the best place to learn more about Chinese lives in Singapore. Once you step inside, you will feel like you are travelling back to the old days. Great presentation!

Welcome back to Singapore in the early 60s! Catch a glimpse into the resilience, tenacity and hopeful spirit of the forefathers who help build the nation through difficult times. History unfolds as you journey through time. This place has translation sets to help explain the perspectives, thoughts and emotions of those who lived through those days. Not to be missed if you were to visit Chinatown!

pricing.others: (General admission with multimedia guide) Adult: S$15, Child: S$11; (General admission with guided tour) Adult: S$20, Child: S$16.

results.description: Visitors can learn more about the pioneers who came from China to start a new life in Singapore and their contributions toward nation-building.
results.name: Chinatown Heritage Centre

results.body: This is a fine example of the Chinese Tang dynasty style of architecture in the heart of Chinatown. As its name suggests, the museum houses a tooth relic of Buddha, as well as other revered artefacts. Built in 2007, the temple takes up the complex’s ground floor, and visitors will marvel at the rich interiors comprising paintings, statues & other exhibits related to Buddha and Buddhism. The building also has a roof garden, a library, a vegetarian restaurant in the basement and a bookstore. Visitors can gain more insight into the Buddhist way of life during the “Discovering Buddhism” workshop.

reviews.text: Lovely temple to visit. Very humbling to watch the prayers. Glorious architecture. Near a lovely market Street too. If you're hungry, try Blue Ginger restaurant down the road for traditional and yummy food.

Was greeted by the beautiful architecture of the temple as it goes up to multiple storeys high. Was paying a visit to this for the first time. Get to pay respects by praying with the provided josticks at the first level.
DO NOT go away after praying at first level, as there are multiple storeys above for people who are interested to explore! There are museums exhibiting historical artifacts and descriptive articles for tourists or just anyone who feels their knowledge in their religion is not sufficient.
Do take your time to explore the levels and especially for level 2 as it really sends you through an amazing informative journey about the life of the Buddha.

Peaceful temple to visit where you can mediate and be silence with the Buddha tooth relic. Spiritual experience despite the temple being quite humble in size. It comes with a excellent Buddha's life exhibition that has top quality exhibition quality. If you are in Singapore, do visit.

Beautiful , peaceful are two words that define this place. Make sure u wear appropriate clothes and skirts should not be above knees. There are few sections where photography is not allowed. There are total 4 levels in the temple and a little orchard garden on the top where I can sit back and relax or enchant the god's name.

Words cannot fully describe this place. Beautiful, serene, educational. Do not come here on a time crunch, it must be fully enjoyed. Also, make time to go to all four levels of the building. The museum of artifacts and relics is amazing.

results.admissionInfo: Free
results.description: The Chinese Tang dynasty-style building in the heart of Chinatown houses a tooth relic of Buddha, as well as other revered artefacts.
results.name: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum

results.body: Singapore’s oldest Hindu temple was rebuilt as Sri Mariamman Temple, dedicated to goddess Mariamman, who is believed to heal the sick. During the colonial period, it was a first refuge for new immigrants, a dispute mediation venue and where marriage ceremonies were held for Hindus. Travellers who visit in October-November may get to observe the Theemithi, which is the main festival observed here. Visitors can marvel at the temple’s six-tiered gopuram, or grand tower entrance. The visual treat continues with the temple’s elaborate interiors, featuring shrines with statues of different deities.

reviews.text: This is a place that has such history and the architecture is so detailed. The sculptures decorating the temple are fantastic. Also you have the opportunity to go in there. For women, you have to have your head covered when you go in. It has a calming feeling when you sit in there.

Definitely a great sensory experience. The temple has great design and decor. The sounds are fantastic with vocal and instrumental offerings to the deities. The unique smells that one can only experience in a ritual setting and the tastes of the offerings that the devotees make available. All in all, a great way to experience the hindu culture of devotion.
Visiting Mariamman temple is thrilling in a foreign land. Well maintained. Architecture is fine with masonry details. People of all religion visit it.

it was really a great experience seeing the evening prayers ceremony. We have also been offered food (prasad) which was tasty and they welcomed us like they (who sponsored the prayers) know us. It was amazing to see the south Indian traditions. 

Even i have been in Indian from the last 30 years but never got a chance to see such a ceremony inside a temple.

Very accessible. Beautiful artwork. Amazing snaps to be taken.

 Just a point for tourists to note, please remove your footwear at the entrance of the temple before entering. Also, kindly note as it is a holy place, please be respectful and dress appropriately (not recommended to be dressed shorts/tube tops) at the venue.

results.admissionInfo: Free
results.description: Singapore’s oldest Hindu temple was once a refuge for new immigrants, a dispute mediation venue and where marriage ceremonies were held for Hindus.
results.name: Sri Mariamman Temple

results.body:
Our multiple award-winning Cultural Cooking Class programme is designed to help you dive deep into the fascinating side of Singapore’s food heritage and culture in an informal and fun atmosphere. You will discover how our multi-racial society blended together in a perfect harmony through food. Thereafter, you will have lots of hands-on fun learning how to cook up three authentic Singaporean dishes under the guidance of friendly instructors during this 3-hour cooking class.

Don't worry, we have specially designed the class format such that even if you have never stepped into the kitchen before, you will be able to learn at your own pace and have fun!

reviews.text: This class was recommend by my niece. It was run & enjoyable & a great learning experience. If you are an experienced or novice cook you will enjoy & get something out of this class. i loved learning about the history behind the heritage foods. Being a former Singaporean I am familiar with Singapore food & the dishes we made were really delicious & authentic. Helen is an engaging teacher. I am looking forward to returning for another lass & highly recommend it to others seeking a fun culinary adventure in Singapore.

I've never been to a cooking class while I'm love to cooking.
The course was fabulous not only in cooking but in discovering the history of the country... 
Teresa our extraordinary teacher, she told us, and explained how to cook as my grandmother or my mother would have done with the same passion. 
I will definitely take part in the next course, to talk and gain the experience that the teachers of FOOD PLAYGROUND have !!!!!
Is too interesting and fun. A big thank you to everyone !!

Great to get back to Food Playground after doing a great class here 4 yrs ago. Love that you get a hands on cooking experience while learning about the food culture and history of Peranakan food in Singapore. Mary was a terrific tutor sharing her own family experience and upbringing. 
Daniel (owner) is the champion of this meaningful social cause, which is to help more stay-at-home mothers return to the workforce by providing them with meaningful flexible employment opportunities so they can stay connected to society, earn some income for their family and regain their self-confidence. 
Highly recommended as the first thing to do during any stay in the lion city!

One of the best parts of our Singapore vacation! Intimate cooking class where we learned about the history of Singapore dishes while making our own. Great whether you are a beginner or a professional.

Wonderful experience and a tremendous way to spend a morning in Singapore'. Teresa was our instructor and not only did she teach us cooking techniques but also the history of the dishes we made. She had an excellent way of presenting her subject and adding humorous personal tidbits made for a very easy and tasty learning experience. I would recommend this @session to anyone who is visiting Singapore and wants to understand the culture and food. You won't be disappointed.

results.description: Our signature Cultural Cooking Classes let you dive deep into the fascinating side of Singapore’s food heritage and culture, and cook up local family recipes like Laksa, Hainanese Chicken Rice and Satay using fresh local ingredients
results.name: Food Playground

results.body: With its distinctive front gate and minarets, Jamae Mosque may seem like a curious oddity in its predominantly Chinese location in Chinatown. But, along with its neighbour, Sri Mariamman Temple, Jamae Mosque has been a prominent landmark in South Bridge Road for nearly 200 years, often appearing in early illustrations, photographs and postcards.

reviews.text: A heritage mosque in the Chinatown area. Located in the heart of city centre. 99 names of Allah written on the wall. Interior is very nice and attractive.
Very good place to remember Allah and perform Solath. Spacious and clean, well maintained

Very old mosque, Spacious
Juma starts at 1:40
Singapore heritage,
Good north indian food option just outside
Jumma masjid where prime minister Narendra Modi visited last year on his Singapore visited

Masjid Jamae (Chulia) or Jamae (Chulia) Mosque is one of the earliest mosques in Singapore, and is located on South Bridge Road in the Chinatown district within the Central Area. The mosque was established in 1826. This mosque is also known as Chulia Mosque and Periya Palli (meaning the Big Mosque) among the Tamil Muslim community in Singapore. Together with its neighbour, Sri Mariamman Temple, the mosque stands out in its predominantly Chinese location. The Mosque Street that runs beside it may have been named after this mosque.

results.admissionInfo: Free
results.description: A salient landmark in South Bridge Road, this scenic mosque promises to be a feast for the eyes.
results.name: Jamae Mosque

reviews.text: Don't go by its size or location. The service isn't not to your expectations, beyond to what you think! Great service and staff. Fantastic experience I have. Just drop and feel like you are at your another home. I have ever seen such homely food in any abroad place so far. You can't compare either breakfast, lunch or dinner with such combination of food items. My rating is not five 🌟 but 5 🌟+++++.☝.
Great place to stay at Little India. Rooms are extraordinarily beautiful. Provides basic amenities like toiletries, slippers, electric kettle, mini fridge etc. Superb breakfast buffet.

The rooms were rather small, but was clean. The staff were helpful and it was close to the Metro and local eateries. Perfect place if you like Indian or Pakistani food; decent neighborhood as well. Recommend for couples, travelers on a budget or in transit.

Perfect location for Indian tourists. The staff was very polite and the humility was exceptional. The hotel was very helpful and understanding to personal needs. Very happy with the overall experience.
Too good & clean ..... Staff is very good.... 😍food is  testy.. Love it..

results.body: AQUEEN Heritage Hotel—Little India is situated at the heart of Little India, giving guests the perfect spot from which they can explore the cultural precinct. Its contemporary rooms are furnished with Quintessential by Aqueen™ mattresses, the first of its kind in the hospitality industry. Handicap-accessible rooms are also available. Visitors who wish to shop around the area can head to the Little India Arcade or the iconic 24-hour shopping mall, Mustafa Centre. The hotel is also close by to mosques such as the Masjid Abdul Gafoor and Sultan Mosque, making it convenient for Muslim travellers who wish to pray. For those who want to go further, Little India MRT Station is just a four-minute walk away from the hotel and takes guests directly to destinations such as Chinatown and Orchard Road.
results.amenities: Smoke-free Hotel,Free Wi-Fi,Wheelchair Accessible,Laundry & Dry Cleaning
results.name: AQUEEN Heritage Hotel - Little India
results.description: With a cultural precinct at its doorstep, this hotel offers the perfect stay for culture lovers and history buffs.

reviews.text: Excellent check in service. Solid perks for platinum members. Tasty breakfast and a fantastic location. I would have loved a bigger room upgrade given my Lifetime Titanium Elite Status. The views were nice, and the beds were very comfortable.

Rooms were spacious and clean. I really enjoyed the roof top bar and pool. The staff was pretty good and friendly. The breakfast was terrible but you can't bat 1000 on everything. Would definitely stay there again.

Loved everything about this hotel!! Convenient location near a mall and metro station, very efficient service, and hospitable and friendly staff. Great facilities!! The rooftop pool, bar, restaurant and gym are a great bonus for indulgence! Highly recommended! PS. You can get a view of the Marina from the seats on the left of the pool!

Very new hotel. Staff very helpful. I did not have my Type-C charging cable and the hotel room only has standard USB cable. The staff ask around from her colleagues and someone lend me her personal charging cable. I am very pleased with the kind of help I received.

Lacks some of the core amenities urban Marriott properties usually offer platinum/titanium members such as an executive lounge and free drinks in the evening, which brings the rating down. The location is also slightly weird since the hotel does nothing to emphasize local businesses or attractions. However, great views from the corner rooms as well as the rooftop bar/infinity pool.

results.body: Located in the Novena district, the hotel is just ten minutes away from Orchard Road, Singapore?s premier shopping belt and Little India. The nearby historical Balestier Heritage Trail allows travellers to explore a typical heartland neighbourhood.
results.amenities: Baby Cot;Swimming Pool;Connecting Rooms;Wheelchair Accessible;Gym;Free Wi-Fi;Laundry & Dry Cleaning;
results.name: Courtyard by Marriott Singapore Novena
results.description: Courtyard by Marriott Singapore Novena is the latest hotel to join the Marriott family, with 250 rooms and direct access to Novena MRT station and nearby shopping malls. Occupying the level 22 to 33 of the Royal Square at Novena mixed-used development, all the stylishly appointed rooms showcase clean line furnishings, with full-length bay windows displaying panoramic views of the cityscape and the nature reserve. Guests can choose to dine at the hotel?s all-day dining restaurant Sky22, recharge at the Lobby Lounge or head up to the 33rd floor for cocktails at the Urbana rooftop bar. Other facilities include a 20-metre rooftop infinity pool, fitness centre and two meeting rooms.  The Courtyard by Marriott Singapore Novena is the hotel of choice for trailblazing business and leisure travellers looking for alternative accommodation options at the fringe of the city, where they can Make Room for A Little Fun.

reviews.text: Great place on the edge of little India. The room, albeit small, felt quirky and fun. Great atmosphere on an evening. The only tiny downside was that breakfast began at 7.30, so if you have to catch an early flight you miss out.

This hotel has a 3 floors.  It is neat and clean.  The rooms size may be smaller but has a big cot for 2 people.  It is a compact size room concept.  A small room with attached toilet / bath (no tub)  and a wash basin.  there is a swimming pool too, it is smaller in size but it is good enough to float arnd for a while.

The service from the staff is good. The in-room amenities are also satisfying. I like the in-room interior also. There are two breakfast options (Asian and Western) and there was only one option available, yet I find this is somehow acceptable. However what I find disappointing, I could barely sleep because of the people in the first floor, I believe, that have noisy laughs and midnight conversation. They end around 4AM. Hope the management can be aware of this.
Location is quite prime for a hotel in town. The room is clean. Design and architecture is good too. However, facilities can be improved. Service is good and staff is nice.
Friendly staff.. nice food.. portion just nice =)

results.body: The Great Madras is a quaint, yet vibrant hotel located in the Little India precinct, and is near the Bugis neighbourhood. The heritage building is the perfect Instagrammable getaway, with colourful, retro interiors, neon lights and chic rooms. In the lobby, visitors will find a barber shop and a halal bistro. Rooms are artfully decorated with fun prints and equipped with basic amenities such as a kettle, coffee and tea packets. Travellers on a budget can stay in The Great Madras’s deluxe hostel, a co-living space with king-sized beds and a sliding door that can be closed to form individual private rooms. Mixed and all-female hostels are also available.
results.amenities: Smoke-free Hotel,Free Wi-Fi,Wheelchair Accessible,Swimming Pool,Gift Shop,Laundry & Dry Cleaning,Qibla Compass,Prayer Facilities,Connecting Rooms
results.name: The Great Madras
results.description: This boutique hotel offers a offers travellers a cosy stay within a heritage building.

reviews.text: This hotel was great! They knew it was our first stay with them so they took extra care to make us feel welcome. This is a clean and nice hotel! Love the pool areas. They have a nice spa area that we had all to ourselves, as well as a really nice rooftop pool. I would definitely come here again.

My stay was only for two nights and it was a splurge for me staying at this 5* hotel. I loved everything about it. Located in Little India, it is easily accessible via MRT to all other areas in Singapore. I took a taxi to and from the airport, approx $15. 

Room was super nice and bed was great. I was given a handicap room - I was not a fan as I prefer a standard bath and I'm not handicap. Breakfast was included in my rate and it was a wonderful way to start my sightseeing days. Another perk for staying in this hotel was spa access. I basically had the thermal suite pool all to myself.

Overall it was a great stay and well worth the splurge.

I booked this hotel independently, from UK. Very impressed, it is on the edge of little India right next door to the MRT STATION ( for easy travel around Singapore)
Our room was on 13 floor with great views across the city. 
The hotel reception staff are very attentive, we arrived early - they had our room made up very quickly and were in it 3 hours early. 
They have two outside swimming pools, gym, conference rooms. 
A good hotel for the holidaying visitor or business guest. 
You will not be disappointed, Very reasonably priced. 
Go on book, you'll enjoy.

Came to try the spa, loved it! It is so peaceful, the massage was very good. Service is top notch and they do not sell you. You can relax at the jacuzzis and the steam rooms, or the couch inside. A very relaxing and pleasant experience!

The room is clean and elegant. Like the free minibar items (just soft soda) and the free snacks. Room service is very lacking, they would often forget things like your drinks or condiments or napkins. When asked to bring up extra glasses or tea cups or water bottles they would always ask "Don't you already have some in your room? Why do you need more?". Overall, you get a good price for your room but you don't even get close to the service you would expect from a 5-star hotel.

results.body:
One Farrer Hotel is the leading 5-star urban hotel-resort in Singapore defined by an intuitive and trend setting approach towards lifestyle and hospitality. Situated in one of Singapore’s heritage districts, with Farrer Park MRT station right at its doorstep, an award-winning permanent collection of over 700 pieces of original contemporary abstract art from across Greater Asia, the largest of its kind in Singapore takes pride in the hotel. Spanning over 20 Levels, residents can also explore 15 water and tropical gardens, including a fully operational Farm.

Encompassing three ‘hotels within a hotel', the Urban Hotel, Loft Apartments and Skyline Hotel & Sky Villas, the 243 chic contemporary rooms, studios, apartments, suites and villas were designed to meet and exceed the expectations of the discerning traveller. In addition to many thoughtful amenities, complimentary mini bars and Wi-Fi are also offered throughout.
results.name: One Farrer Hotel
results.description: One Farrer Hotel is the leading 5-star urban hotel-resort in Singapore defined by an intuitive and trend setting approach towards lifestyle and hospitality.

reviews.text: Stayed here as a part of the Singapore Stopover Holiday deal, so had great cheaply priced nights. Rooms were a reasonable size and were relatively nice and well decorated. Got the breakfast one morning, which was a buffet and had a broad range of different options. Overall had a pleasant stay for a couple of nights

We stayed at this hotel for 1 night because Signapore Airlines covered our stay for stopover. Their full attention, sincere delightful hospitality, and good quality service went beoynd our expectations. WoW! Their warm hospitality touched our feelings and made our heartfelt. Rooms are okay and average.
We had an issue with room and they quickly changed it. We were happy.
The hotel location is perfect and easy to walk 4 minutes to shopping stores and Mellower Coffee via Queen Street. We loved coffee drinks Ondeh at nearby qurky popular coffee Mellower Coffee in center of Singapore.
Very well located. Well mannered staff
Good Location, very helpful staff, currently a little old fashioned rooms,but they are renovating, For vegetarians food is an issue.... otherwise a average place to stay...
Nice hotel near some restaurant if you want get dinner in out of hotel area. Good service. Hospitality crew and check in fee about 1 million up here

results.body:
Hotel Royal @ Queens is a 4-Star Smoke-Free Hotel in Singapore strategically located in the heart of the city’s dynamic business, cultural and entertainment hubs.

Some of the major landmarks of the city that are located within walking distance include the Singapore Management University (SMU), Esplanade Theatres by the Bay, Suntec City Convention Centre, Marina Square, Raffles Shopping Centre, Raffles Hospital, Bugis Village, Orchard Road, Chinatown, Little India, Boat Quay, Clarke Quay.

Hotel Royal @ Queens Singapore has 231 well-appointed guest rooms and 8 Serviced Apartments. Guest rooms are clean, comfortable, cosy and furnished with contemporary decor. Wireless Broadband internet access is available in all rooms and public areas.
results.name: Hotel Royal @ Queens (Singapore) Pte Ltd
results.description: Hotel Royal @ Queens is a 4-Star Smoke-Free Hotel in Singapore strategically located in the heart of the city’s dynamic business, cultural and entertainment hubs.

reviews.text:
Really convenient location. Directly connected to Farrer park station and 5 min walk to Mustafa center.
Room size is not big but new, clean and compactly placed all facilities.
Most remarkable point is affordable price. Good cost performance!!
Good location. Very good infrastructure. Customer friendly staffs. Food quality very very good.
Pleasant Stay!  Courteous staff,  compact but comfy rooms. Many Indian restaurants around. Easy accessible public transport - metro station.
Thumbs up! Room is very comfortable and quiet, friendly staffs as well. Highly recommend :)
Awesome location. Beautiful rooms. Service could be better

results.body:
The evolution of Farrer Park over the years has seen a significant change from aviation and racecourse heydays to a vibrant commercial community at present. The first plane to fly over Singapore left its mark over the Farrer Road precinct. Pretty fly if you know what we mean.

Located right on top of Farrer Park MRT Station, the 300-room hotel is situated amidst a backdrop of the district's vibrant enclave; where bountiful sights and sounds within this ethnic community thrive.

A medley of old and new - the building's façade and classic silhouette blends tastefully with the surrounding heritage pre-war shop houses. More than just a place to stay, the hotel also offers a diverse selection of dining options complemented by a club lounge, swimming pool and gym facilities. Park Hotel Farrer Park is the gateway to the neighbourhood's quaint alley ways and ethnic charms, ensuring each stay has its own story to tell.
results.companyDisplayName: RB CAPITAL FARRER HOTEL PTE. LTD.
results.amenities: Children's Pool;Serves Halal Food;Gym;Wheelchair Accessible;Free Wi-Fi;Connecting Rooms;Qibla Compass;Club Lounge;
results.name: Park Hotel Farrer Park
results.description: Centrally situated and in one of Singapore's most bustling districts, Park Hotel Farrer Park enjoys a prime location atop Farrer Park MRT station, providing unbeatable accessibility around the vicinity, to the city and Central Business District. Standing tall amongst surrounding shopping complexes, quaint restaurants and historical shop houses, the 20-storey new-build hotel with its sleek glass exteriors offers panoramic views of the vibrant district.   Home to a mix of 300 contemporary guest rooms, Sky Loft and Premier Loft rooms coupled with modern amenities, Park Hotel Farrer Park, one of the best hotels in Farrer Park also features three dining outlets, a swimming pool and gymnasium ideal for business travel or family holidays.
results.source: RB CAPITAL FARRER HOTEL PTE. LTD.

reviews.text: The Andaz in Singapore is a great hotel. The room was spacious, clean and has all amenities you could ask for. The pool is nice (not very big though) and overlooking the city. The breakfast is the only drawback. Its very crowded in the mornings and a bit unclear what's self service and what not. Apart from this, good choice.
Food was delicious. Concept of choosing which restaurant to go is unique. Lunch value set is good. Will come back.

It is at a great location. It has a tea room people can gather for tea or coffee for free. Various Restaurant for food from various country. The room is spacious and clean. View is spectacular. One has to request Harbour view.

The room is very stylish, room amenities are well stocked and complimentary. The only problem I have is the pillows. Seems like they bought it on a low budget. The moment you lie on it, it sinks flat. I did ask for new ones. But there is no difference. If to compare the comfort level, it's the lowest from hotels I have stayed in.

Excellent hotel with super helpful and friendly staff. The rooms were spacious (especially for such a dense populated city!) and extremely modern; with electric curtains and a speaker to use). Free drinks and snacks in the minibar also turned out to be useful after a night out 😄

Furthermore, perfect location in city center and a great pool with a nice view. However, there were not enough sun-beds for all the guests. 

Definitely worth a revisit!

results.body: Situated near Marina Bay and at the crossroads of the Kampong Glam, Little India and Bras Basah Bugis cultural districts, with their intimate shophouse-filled alleyways and atmospheric colours, textures and flavours, Andaz Singapore hotel aims to spark off a sense of discovery of the rich culture of Singapore, and inspire guests to experience the city through fresh perspectives.
results.name: Andaz Singapore
results.description: Stay at Andaz to be inspired by cultural districts to discover Singapore's heritage.

reviews.text: Very good hotel. 10-20 minutes from the airport. Very quick service for check in and checkout. Not good for Asian or South Asian people in respect to food in breakfast. Rooms are a little small but good if you are roaming around the city in the day. Markets and shopping center are in walking distance.

Booked a superior double for 2, the room was really quite small which is expected. Glad it’s quite clean though. They do charge a fee of 2-3% for credit card payment, which I think they shouldn’t have. Most hotels in Singapore just absorbed it as operation cost instead of transferring the merchant fees to customers. What they charging may be higher than what the bank’s charging them though.
Overall service was not bad. Front office staff is helpful.

Very good staff at the front office. Helped us to make a few calls to the tour guide and gave directions to so many places. Rooms are clean and nice but tiny. Our one was with a nice view towards Victoria street. Waiting distance to many good shopping locations. very easy to catch a bus
Breakfast was horrible as we were eating the same thing for 4 days

Great location and great price.  The front desk at the hotel is constantly busy.  Uber is not available in Singapore, however they have this app called Grab.  Works exactly the same.  Use that to get to the hotel instead of taking a taxi.  The rooms are fairly small but very clean.  The staffs are all wonderful to deal with.  The gym is small as well with about 6 machines/equipment all together.

Considering it is advertised as a 4 star hotel the standard is poor.  Rooms are small and lacking in storage. Best advise is use for a short stay only. Breakfast is best described as either one of the four letter words one starting with s and ending with a t or starting with c and ending in p. There is supposedly a Western restaurant  but can't get an English breakfast No bacon...

results.body: With 1,500 rooms spread across 11 room types, Hotel Boss caters to every traveller’s needs. The 19-storey hotel boasts a business centre, outdoor pool, shopping alley and eateries such as halal restaurant Jubilicious. It is next to Malabar Muslim Jama’ath Mosque, and Sultan Mosque is a seven-minute walk away, convenient for Muslim travellers who wish to pray at a mosque. Art galleries, high-end shopping outlets and quirky local boutiques are nearby. Travellers can walk to Kampong Glam and Little India to learn more about Singapore’s rich heritage.
results.amenities: Free Wi-Fi, Gym, Serves Halal Food, Smoke-Free Hotel, Swimming Pool, Wheelchair Accessible, Airport Shuttle, Gift Shop, Laundry & Dry Cleaning
results.name: Hotel Boss
results.description: Guests will appreciate the business centre, outdoor pool, shopping alley, eateries such as halal restaurant Jubilicious, and the close proximity to Singapore’s cultural precincts.

reviews.text: Nice place to stay. Strategically located. But not exactly worth the price paid for. Rooms are on the smaller side. My room had minor traffic noise despite sealed windows. Price defines it as luxurious, but facilities could ve been better for price paid.
Great hotel in the heart of Singapore near all amenities and eating places. Can be noisy down stairs but rooms of very good standard. Breakfast very poor

Perfect reasonable hotel for stay.
Food is also delicious, they do have Indian food on the menu.
It is located perfectly for tourists.

Pleasant and proactive staff. Clean, tidy and well kept public areas. Near to several Hawker centres. Across the road to an Aladdin's cave of all manner of clothing, accessories and outfits from the Indian subcontinent. A short walking distance to a MRT stop.

Nice hotel but bedrooms fairly small with nowhere to sit except on the bed.  Close to Little India area of Singapore.  In room fridge was so iced up I doubt it would have kept anything cool, however when we mentioned it at reception it was sorted within a few hours.

results.body:
Conveniently located just minutes away from the bright lights of Little India and the culture-rich Straits Chinese enclave of Bugis, Village Hotel Albert Court effortlessly straddles the best of both worlds. While a walk around the compound will uncover traditional Indian and Peranakan carvings and motifs on the walls, a peek into any room will reveal modern facilities catered to both business and leisure travellers.

Stepping out, guests will find themselves within walking distance of both historical and modern attractions such as the Goddess of Mercy Temple and the Singapore Art Museum.

If you’re looking to live like a local, Village Hotel Albert Court will definitely put you right at the centre of it all.
results.name: Village Hotel Albert Court
results.description: Live like a local at Village Hotel Albert Court.

reviews.text:
Novotel Singapore is located in the heart of Clarke Quay, which is a popular area for tourists to stay. It is very well connected via MRT, Bus and Taxi services, and surrounded by a lot of popular restaurant serving different cuisines. 
The hotel itself is also pretty nice with spacious and clean rooms, courteous and helpful staff and extremely child friendly. The breakfast buffet has a lot to chose from, especially and Indian section to cater to guests from India.  
The hotel gives an overall pleasant feel to the guests.
The location and ambience is good. There is swimming and gym. U can enjoy the locality view if u happen to get the right rooms.

Reasonable hotel for a few days.
Breakfast with large variaty, but food is of average quality only.
Fruit with almost no taste and I ate only once worse waffles. 
Rooms are fine; silent, good in size and we'll equipped.
The next Metro and bus stop is only 150m away.

4-star hotel but overall 3-star level.
Room is not renovated recently.
There were 3 of coin laundry machine and dryers. 
If you stay at premier floor, you can access the premier lounge where enjoy the snack and beverages. However, I recommend to have the breakfast in the restaurant of 7th floor. 
Very good location where you can Clarke Quay by foot.

Great place in Singapore center. Wonderful skyline view from business lounge on 24th floor. Perfect for family King bed suite. Great people, great service. As little minus, slightly worn furniture in a room, but it doesn't change very positive impression.

results.body:
Nestled along the banks of the historical Singapore River, Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay offers a blend of history and hip – making it the best hotel in the city.

Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay has a strategic location in the city, between the Central Business District (CBD), Marina Bay and just minutes to the Orchard Road shopping street.

The hotel is adjacent to the vibrant and hottest multicultural nightspot of Singapore, Clarke Quay with over 150 restaurants and bars. It is connected to Liang Court shopping mall, fondly known as Little Japan to the locals.

Sheltered access to the Downtown Line Fort Canning MRT Station allows for easy access to all the major Singapore city spots including the Central Business District, Marina Bay, Chinatown and Little India, as well as direct access to Changi Airport.

Each of the 403 upgraded rooms boasts a magnificent view of the Marina Bay, Singapore River or the lush greenery of Fort Canning Park. Ranging from Standard to Premier Suite, all guest rooms have been carefully designed to blend ergonomics with spacious, modern designs and colourful décor, while maintaining the relaxation and comfort every Novotel hotel is globally known for.

Novotel’s signature all-day dining restaurant, The Square, will certainly fulfil guests’ appetites with superb international and local cuisine. The hotel lounge, Le Bar Rouge is a perfect venue to chat with friends and colleagues while enjoying light drinks and meals.
results.amenities: Business Centre;Gym;Swimming Pool;Club Lounge;Free Wi-Fi;Laundry & Dry Cleaning;Baby Cot;Connecting Rooms;Smoke-free Hotel;Baby-sitting Services;
results.name: Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
results.description: Hotel accommodation | City Hotel | 4 Star Hotel

reviews.text: Spent 3d2n at the club room of the village hotel at katong. Overall great stay. Place was clean and room service was quick (done over the span of our breakfast, was a pleasant surprise). The staff were all super friendly and helpful with our requests (both front desk and club lounge). Would recommend and also go for the club room experience.

The room is spacious, clean, and nicely designed. The smart phone provided is really handy. Google maps is available in the phone with free data usage. We purchase some attraction ticket from it for a lower price. Free call to local number as well as some other country which is in the list. There’s a supermarket in the same building. And quite a lot of eateries around the hotel. Do try the ice cream from “bird of paradise” which is only few steps away from the hotel. The only downside is the parking, not free/discounted even for hotel guest. On average we paid SGD15 for overnight parking.

Great place for people who are in for the first time in Singapore. One of the best value for money hotels. Clean rooms, nice ambience. The best part is they provide you a phone which you can use while traveling. Good option for those people who are traveling without any tours travels/tour package. I loved it
Very nice hotel. Family room was big enough, nice beds, clean. Free airport shuttle definitely made it convenient to get to and from airport. Will definitely come again.
Great staff, great service. We celebrated our birthday here and were very happy with the room. Phone manners could be improved on.

results.body:
Leave the usual cityscape behind and discover a lesser-known Singapore at Village Hotel Katong. Located in the historic Katong and Joo Chiat heritage district, the hotel will transport you back in time with its authentic Peranakan décor and furniture. Look a little closer and you might even be able to see the different Malay, Indian, Arabic, and European influences that played a part in shaping this unique culture.
 
In the immediate vicinity, you can effortlessly live like a local and see how the Peranakans left their mark on everything from design to cuisine as you stroll past old shophouses and visit authentic Peranakan restaurants. Go just a little farther out and the old will soon give way to the new at the nearby Parkway Parade shopping mall, a subtle reminder that modern conveniences are never far away when you stay at Village Hotel Katong.
results.name: Village Hotel Katong
results.description: Leave the usual cityscape behind and discover a lesser-known Singapore at Village Hotel Katong.

reviews.text: This is not a five star hotel. Although very enjoyable the breakfast was a bit crazy as it was very busy. The setting is nice. Had a room looking over the river.

Had a lovely 3 day stay at this hotel last week. Beautiful room, comfortable bed and great shower.
Reception staff were extremely helpful and pleasant during checking in and out and when answering general questions we had, never having visited Singapore before. 
We ate in the restaurant for a buffet lunch and dinner. The chef was on hand and happily explained any dishes we were unfamiliar with. A problem with the evening meal was dealt with and resolved to our satisfaction by the restaurant supervisor. 
A good location near to an underground station meant we could easily explore the city.  Quality shopping on Orchard Road just outside
Thoroughly recommend.

Clean and efficient... Great experience for the price they charge...Location is also exception... It is a bit of a walk from the MRT if you have heavy luggage... Else it is wonderful... Would happily stay here again

Your new bar and restaurant suck.  The bar is too busy you don’t have enough servers.  When I asked if I could order something to eat I was told we have peanuts.  I went to the restaurant instead your server didn’t offer anything to drink took my food order and walked away.  I had to flag him down to get something to drink.  I come here often on business and in the past it was first class, you seem to have lost your customer service.
Very nice hotel, nice  room and very good location next door to orchard towers. Only problem was they were doing construction and could not sleep at all. Would give 4 stars but could not sleep.

results.body:
Located along Orchard Road, and just a short walk from the MRT station, Orchard Hotel features a half Olympic-size outdoor swimming pool, a life-size chessboard, and fully-equipped fitness centre. Its perfect location and choice offerings for business and leisure make for a stay secluded from the hustle of the busy city, whilst Singapore’s top shopping and entertainment options are available on its doorstep.

Contemporary, yet classic in style, our 656 tastefully appointed guest rooms feature modern conveniences and Chinese accents, allowing guests to feel truly at home. Amenities include flat-screen TVs with premium cable channels, rain showers and pillow menus, along with complimentary Wi-Fi.

Gourmands will delight in sumptuous dining options at our five dining establishments, namely authentic Cantonese cuisine at one of Singapore’s top Chinese restaurants, Hua Ting Restaurant, hearty international and local buffet at Orchard Cafe; gourmet hotpot at Hua Ting Steamboat; and French-influenced bistro fare at Mon Bijou. For wind-down sessions, settle for a tipple at the cosy Intermezzo Bar with live entertainment. 

A total of 20,000 square feet of function space is at your disposal, including one of the largest pillar-free ballrooms accommodating up to 1,500 guests.
results.amenities: Club Lounge;Business Centre;Free Wi-Fi;Laundry & Dry Cleaning;Gym;Wheelchair Accessible;Connecting Rooms;Baby-sitting Services;Carpark;ATMs Check;Swimming Pool;Baby Cot;Serves Halal Food;
results.name: Orchard Hotel Singapore
results.description: Located along Orchard Road, and just a short walk from the MRT station, Orchard Hotel features a half Olympic-size outdoor swimming pool, a life-size chessboard, and fully-equipped fitness centre.

reviews.text: Super clean and well-maintained rooms! The staff is courteous and friendly. Plenty of eating out places around, also a small supermarket right next to the hotel adjacent to the fuel station. Walkable distance from the MRT stations.

Don't know about the rooms, but the restaurant is superb....Petite Menu.
Nice setting, good service staff, and good menu...all deliciously prepared. We are a group of 26 persons hence had a good look at many of the dishes. Well prepared, beautifully presented.
The outside look.Good but I have not gone inside
The set lunch is good and cheap
Good hotel, convenient location next to MRT, has halal kitchen

results.body: With meeting and event facilities, Aqueen Hotel Paya Lebar appeals to those visiting for business or leisure. Its 162 contemporary rooms are furnished with Quintessential by Aqueen™ mattresses, the first of its kind in the hospitality industry. Guests staying for at least two nights will receive a prepaid mobile card with credit, local data and free calls to 19 destinations worldwide. Visitors who wish to explore the area could do some shopping at Paya Lebar Square and OneKM Mall. For those who wish to go a little further, attractions such as the Singapore Flyer, Haji Lane and Esplanade – Theatres on the Bay are less than 10 minutes away by car. Free parking is available on the hotel’s premises.
results.amenities: Connecting Rooms, Free Wi-Fi, Wheelchair Accessible, Laundry & Dry Cleaning
results.name: Aqueen Hotel Paya Lebar
results.description: Great for business travellers, guests will receive a prepaid mobile card with credit, local data and free calls to 19 destinations.

reviews.text: Very helpful.  The modern information centre is just temporary I think, while the historic one is revamped

Any questions you got about where to go and how to get there, they can sort you out. They got info on what's going on and when. Also they got cool things happening right inside of the center as well. Like perfume making, or some kinda craft or even poetry and all for free. I always pop in to ask which bus I need to go here, or there
If you are visiting Singapore this place should be your first stop, very friendly helpful knowledgeable staff.
Great information around singapore
Nice information. Interactive

results.body: The Singapore Visitor Centre is set in a two-storey conserved Peranakan shophouse in the heritage-rich Emerald Hill area. The centre provides services like the sale of tours, attraction, event tickets and booking of accommodation. Key feature of the SVC is the use of technology to help visitors. There are four interactive kiosk that allow visitors to browse and put together a digital itinerary. This personalised itinerary can be printed or emailed to visitors. Besides this, there are also two large screens that display a variety of places of interest and events in Singapore. Complimentary WiFi is also available within the SVC. On top of this, check out the Singapore Experience Lab, an interactive showcase of Singapore’s hidden gems and must-dos for visitors. There are also on-going interactive events curated for visitors who are keen to find out more about our culture.
results.description: Drop by the Singapore Visitor Centre to get more information about Singapore, purchase tickets to attractions, tours and check out interactive events.
results.name: Singapore Visitor Centre

reviews.text: Unfortunately the cable car is too hot. I asked the staff before the doors of the cable car closed if it would cool down. They said yes the fan is on. Well it didn't. I used my hand fan but that wasn't enough. When I reached the Sentosa stop I went to the ticket counter and asked for a refund for the return. I was told that I couldn't receive a refund because, I rode the cable car. Of course I wouldn't have ridden it if the staff had said the temperature would NOT cool down. I don't like to post non-positive reviews but, as a traveler this is information I would have found important before I had made my decision to take the Singapore Cable Car.

Get round trip tickets for value for money ! That way, you can explore the island on foot and hop on the cable car when the feet starts to ache. The souvenir shops are awesome..the gifts sold are thoughtful and cater to all ages, from a foldable walking cane to plush toys for the young ones! If only there was a commentary in the cable car, it would be even better!

It was an unique thrilling experience of riding by a cable car. We bought round tickets which helped us to explore many stations on ground including Sentosa island. Sentosa Island has many transport modes of reaching from the Mainland. 

There are many attractions at each of the stations including restaurants and tourists’ facilities. Beautiful picturesque surroundings and one can take lot of photos for remembrance. We thoroughly enjoyed the cable car ride.

Very nice experience. A must visit for tourists. One of the ways to enter Sentosa island. Make sure you cover all the stations and morning and evening times. Do visit Faber peak as cable car is the fastest and easiest way to go there. It runs till 9:30 in night so plan accordingly.

Very friendly team. I have been there twice and the experience is next to none. Plenty of staffs and ask them as many questions as you want and they will assist you with anything. 
Supports available for disabled tourists. 
Public transport access available which is under the shopping mall. 
If you are planing to visit Sentosa island then you must experience this.

results.body:
Experience Faber Peak Singapore and Sentosa with Cable Car Sky Network

Get onboard the Cable Car Sky Network, a fun way to fly from Singapore’s only hilltop destination, Faber Peak Singapore, to over 20 attractions in Sentosa! Soar high above for priceless views of the exciting island, golden beaches and beautiful greenery. Catch this unique joyride on the Mount Faber Line and the Sentosa Line.
results.amenities: Carpark,Free Wi-Fi,Shuttle to Places of Interest,Wheelchair Accessible
results.admissionInfo:
Cable Car Sky Pass (Mount Faber Line + Sentosa Line): $35.00 Adult $25.00 Child
Cable Car - Mount Faber Line (Into Sentosa): $33.00 Adult $22.00 Child
Cable Car - Sentosa Line Line (Within Sentosa): $15.00 Adult $10.00 Child
Child aged 4 -12 years old.
results.description: Fly on the Mount Faber Line and Sentosa Line that makes up the Singapore Cable Car Sky Network
results.source: MOUNT FABER LEISURE GROUP PTE. LTD.
results.name: Singapore Cable Car

reviews.text: Great place. Love the exotic animals over here. A lot of different animals that I've not seen before in my life. Place is spotless and children friendly. Would absolutely come back to this place again! The price is a little high but definitely worth it. Highly recommended place!

Very nice zoo. The animals have space for themselves and there's really a lot of species to see. I especially liked that certain smaller animals are also not neglected. The blind bald moles have an entire informative little display for them. Extra kudos to the Singapore zoo for specifically displaying information about endangered species such as the rhinos reminding everyone that ground up horn is not an aphrodisiac but the same material as nail clippings or hair. 
The gift shop has a lot of nice products and is worth a visit.

It's one of the best zoo .... Very well maintained.... A must visit place before you die..... The services are really nice you can feed the orangutans.... Have a electric car ride for older people..... Amazing bird show..... Very well trained animals....over all a fantastic place

One of the world's greatest zoos! The Orangutan enclosure is fantastic! The orangutans can actually climb ropes and exit the main enclosure! The baboons are great fun to watch, especially the babies. We loved the bird enclosure where you could walk right beside the lemurs! We had a great time there!

Its my second time being there and still i find it amazing and surprising. lots to see and explore. best part is the it has been designed to make tourists relaxing visit . you can find place to sit and take rest every place. lots of new animals you can explore. couple of live shows are also great. 

Its ranked world’s 3 best zoo and they really deserve it.

results.body: Singapore Zoo has established itself as a world-class wildlife park that houses more than 2,800 animals, which roam freely in naturalistic habitats. A popular programme for visitors is the “Jungle Breakfast with Wildlife”, where the zoo’s iconic orang utan, Ah Meng, makes a regular appearance. A raised boardwalk allows for almost-360° views of the creatures swinging and playing amongst the trees & vegetation. The park’s Fragile Forest zone and Elephants of Asia exhibits are great educational experiences for visitors. Rainforest Kidzworld allows children to spend time with farmyard animals.

pricing.others: Adult: S$33, Child: S$22 (3 - 12 years old),  Senior Citizen: S$15

results.nearestMrtStation: Ang Mo Kio Station / Choa Chu Kang Station / Marsiling Station / Woodlands Station
results.description: A world-class wildlife park where many of its animals roam freely, the Singapore Zoo houses more than 2,800 animals. It is also home to the world’s first free-ranging orang utan habitat. Visitors can enjoy four different animal shows held twice daily at various times.
results.name: Singapore Zoo

reviews.text: If you don't know what to do in your spare time on the trip, chose this flyer! One can't just go wrong with this. You get to see the mesmerizing  landscape of entire Singapore along with a guided interactive infotainment system.

A beautiful place surrounded by many shopping complexes....u can see the Singapore formula 1 track from here..........u can have a beautiful view from the flyer  to see the full city of Singapore. .a place worth the money
..and it has a maximum height of a massive 165 metres height....with special permission you can also dine here......u can even see parts of Malaysia and Indonesia clearly....if u visit singapore this is a must visit place
Nice and huge Ferris wheel in Singapore. A major tourist attraction. Can get a bird eye view of whole Singapore. The wheel rotates slowly and takes about 30-40 min to complete a rotation.
Great tourist attraction in Singapore! We went up at sunset, it was beautiful to watch the sun setting over the city. Would highly recommend!

It was really cool to be on the second tallest Ferris wheel in the world! It gave a great view of The Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Gardens By The Bay, the Art Science Museum, the Singapore city skyline and so much more as well. It was amazing to go on.

results.body:
Introducing FLYER 360+, a multimedia in-capsule experience on Singapore Flyer that enhances the guests’ flight experience with its rich content on Singapore history, culture and iconic landmarks.

This elevates the guests’ experience inside the capsule by adding more interactive and educational elements, and also includes fun facts about Singapore Flyer.

Be treated to a visual 360˚ feast of iconic and historical landmarks 165 metres above the ground. Purchase your flight tickets online now!

Indulge in a multi-sensory dining experience with the Singapore Flyer Sky Dining or toast to the good things in life with the Premium Champagne Flight.
results.admissionInfo:
Singapore Flight
Adults: S$33
Child: S$21
Senior Citizens (Singaporeans and local residents only): S$24
results.description: A moving experience at every turn
results.name: Singapore Flyer

Its ranked world’s 3 best zoo and they really deserve it.
